text: Nagy, tartós hab, egészen sötétbarna szín. Kávés, csokis, pörköltmalátás, aszaltgyümölcsös illat. Csokis, kávés, aszaltgyümölcsös ízvilág, némi kakaóporossággal. Testes, közepesen szénsavas, erős pörkölt keserűvel. Finom, jó arányokkal rendelkező sör.

Aroma of coffee, chocolate, ash, smoke, licorice and soy sauce. Black with a tan head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Full body with a average carbonation. Overall this is a brilliant Stout. Very nicely balanced between notes of sweet chocolate and bitter coffee, without being to sweet nor to bitter.

Pours black with a tan head. 

Aroma of coffee, toffee, dark roasted malts and bitter coffee beans. 

Taste is rather sweet and sugary. Brown sugar. Little roastiness, from dark roasted malts. Balance is kinda off. Too much sweet and not enough bitter. 

Medium body, Watery to oily texture, soft carbonation
Clear black, dark brown lacing foam head. Great bitter coffee aroma and taste. Chocolate notes. A fine beer. (Velp 201706)

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours very dark brown, with a small grey to brown head. Chocolate, milk, coffee, vanilla, fruit flavour. Some smoke. Sweet, with quite a lot of bitterness as well. Smooth. Thick body, soft to flat carbonation. Very good!

330 ml bottle. Opaque brown color. Large bubbly tan head. Rich chocolatey dark malt nose is redolent of espresso. Rich and malty with notes of chocolate ganache and brewed espresso. Dark dried fruit, vanilla and burnt sugar. Quite tasty.

Pours black with a medium, smooth looking, tan head. The aroma is very roasted. Its heavy in chocolate and coffee, along with milder amounts of vanilla, licorice, and a slight caramel. The taste is sweet and bitter, and its fairly heavy in both. While still being roasted, chocolate is the dominant impression. Undertones are balanced between raisin, coffee, cocoa, and licorice. Big chocolate aftertaste sticks with you for quite awhile. This is full in body, has a thick, creamy texture, has flat carbonation. Its very rich so I probably wouldnt drink a ton of these. But its good.
330ml from bottle bought in Kamakura (Japan). This is a really good stout, well balanced, coffee flavour, excellent aftertaste

A: Pitch black with a large tan head
N: Lots of dark roast coffee, some bitter notes
T: A full wallop of coffee on the palate. Strong bitterness. Pairs very well with ice cream. 
P: Medium 
O: Satisfying coffee stout. Quite a bit of gloopy residue at the bottom of the bottle, though.

Pours a black body with a large, creamy, tan and very long-lived head that leaves a decent amount of lacing on my glass. Strong aroma of chocolate sauce, cocoa and dark caramel. After swirling the glass the strong coffee pops up, and almost outshines the previously mentioned notes. Also hints of lactic sugar? Strong flavour that is dominated by strong coffee, also sweet caramel, dark roasted malt and chocolate. Moderate sweet taste followed by a moderate bitter and long-lasting finish. Delicious mouthfeel: full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Brilliant brew! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 6 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Les japonais savent donc également réaliser des stouts. En intégrant directement des grains de café torréfié dans la recette, les arômes de café sont dailleurs bien présents en complément darômes de chocolat (malt choco utilisé) et de fruits (houblons aromatiques Kent Goldings et Chinook) donnant une belle complexité. Côté intensité, petite déception surtout sur le final qui verra les différents arômes sestomper.pour laisser principalement lamertume en bouche.EN verre, la robe de cette Espresso Stout est brun foncé et opaque (quasi noir). Leffervescence, peu marquée et avec de très fines bulles ne permet quà une très faible mousse beige dapparaître à la surface. Le nez est puissant, complexe et sur une belle alliance entre café, chocolat, mélasse et malt torréfié. A la dégustation, lattaque montre également une belle complexité, sur le café en principal, mais finement enrichi par un chocolat doux et des notes fruitées. Celle-ci est souple, avec cependant des arômes peu intenses qui montent alors en puissance, crescendo, avec une deuxième bouche plus présente, sur le malt avec des arômes de chocolat, caramel et de fruits rouges et surtout parfaitement complétée par une arrière bouche présentant une belle amertume et de des notes de café expresso pur de très bonnes factures. A noter le bon choix de houblons, Chinook et Kent Goldings, donnant cette fraîcheur agréable en alliance aux notes de café et ce petit côté fruité conférant de la complexité à la bière. LIBU à 36 est bien pensé, donnant du peps sans être agressif. La troisième bouche est par contre relativement linéaire avec malheureusement une intensité aromatique décroissant, avant un final moyennement long, présentant des notes de café pas assez brillantes et qui laissent la place à une amertume herbacée provenant du Chinook. Le sucre quant à lui est très bien dosé, mais je me pose la question de lalcool, qui à 7 % Abv aurait pu être légèrement poussé. La bière est mondiale, et nous ne pouvons que nous en réjouir.

0,33l bottl at home bought from Beergonzo. BB 03/2018. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells roasty, earthy, coffee, lactose, cocoa, bitter chocolate, very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, spices, licorice, light caramel, cocoa, lactose, light nuts. finishes lightly roasty bitter with notes of lactose, earthy and cocoa notes. very nice one, taste had some dusty notes at first, but after some breathing it got quite enjoyable. very nice beer overall.

330 ml bottle. deep brown pour verging on black. medium creamy dark tan head with some loose lacing. Aroma is heavy on the dark chocolate, black coffee, espresso, dark fruit. Taste follows leading from medium sweet chocolate to a long lasting roast bitter finish. medium to full body, average carbonation, slightly slick.
Piwo praktycznie czarne, przebłyski pod światło. Spora piana, dosyć gęsta. Dużo espresso, wanilii i czekolady. Piwo jest zaskakująco gęste.

Almost black with a light brown head. Medium carbonation. Aroma: Coffee, liqourice, caramel and malt. Sweet with a roasted bitterness. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: koude koffie, beetje zoet, chocolade.

Smaak: koude koffie, karamel, geroosterd, klein beetje gist.

Lekker
Pours black with a creamy beige top. Notes are licorice, chocolate, toasty malt, espresso bean and blackberry. Carbonation was medium on a lighter body especially for a stout.
Great. Plenty of espresso in the nose. Roasted coffee to taste. Some malty sweetness. Balanced.

Bottle from Janes Beer Store in Mountain View, CA. Aroma is mild espresso, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is sweet milk chocolate, vanilla and some mild coffee candy notes. I was expecting a bit more from this one...not a huge fan of the vanilla sweetness here.
Bottle. Aroma is coffe and roasted. Taste is bitter coffee, dark chocolate, some rosted and some vailla. Dry ending. A decent stout.
Rich and complex aroma. Cocoa, coffee, vanilla, cherries, somehow baltic porter like. Taste: mainly coffee and cocoa. Bit too sour. Very decent beer
33cl bottle purchased @ So bière. Robe noire et fine collerette brune. Bel arôme de café avec un final assez sec. Amertume présente et malt torréfié.
A: Deep dark brown coloured with a thick light beown head N: Tart coffee, chocolate, toffee, caramel T: Coffee, milk chocolate O: Quite thin mouthfeel and a bit tart. Nice balanced coffee though.

Black with a small tan head, no lacing. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Taste heavy on coffee as well, as expected, mouth feel of ice espresso shake, taste of coffee, after taste of coffee... how much coffee do we want? So, if you dont like coffee, leave it on the shelf! Smooth, low carbonated, wonderful treat for coffee lovers!

Bottle, small stable creamy brown head, opaque extremely dark brown color, flavor of toasted dark bread, coffee and cocoa, espresso coffee flavor with vanila, bittersweet chocolate and some toasted bread in the back, mellow sweetness, lightish bitterness, lively carbonation. Nice and highly enjoyable.

Pours black from the bottle. The tan head is thick and creamy and leaves a modest amount of sticky lacing clinging to the glass. The aroma is dark fruit, berry, coffee, and a bit earthy. Taste is bitter with strong coffee notes, dark chocolate, a touch sour. The tartness picks up going into the finish and balances the coffee ground bitterness relatively nicely. I really like the body, which is rich, robust, and smooth. Nice!

Pours black with a beige, nice head. After opening the bottle theres some dark fruits in the aroma, which are soon dominated by black, fresh, roasted coffee. A hint of dark chocolate too. The taste has coffee all over it - very rich, strong, espresso-like coffee, slight sourness from roasted malts, a bit of dark chocolate, dark fruits and vanilla. Very smooth with a long coffee finish. The beer delivers exactly what it promises, it will certainly appeal to coffee lovers.

Amazing aroma the coffee comes through along with a rich malty aroma. Thick pillowy tan head. Taste is smooth creamy with espresso and rich malt. Fairly light carbonation. I think my new favourite stout.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je opravdu lahodně kávové s výrazným nádechem karamelu s lehkým a sladovým pozadím. Pěna je pěkné světle hnědé barvy, má krémově jemnou konzistenci, je vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je temně černá a neprůsvitná. Chuť je sladová s lehkým nádechem tvarohového dortu a velmi příjemným čokoládovým topingem v pozadí je znát slabí kávová hořkost, která dobře koresponduje s celkovou chutí a nevytváří přehnaně silný ocas. V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jaký to příjemný stout se mi to dostal do ruky, opravdu krásná souhra chuti s příjemným aroma. Ji dlouho jsem si tak nepochutnal.

330 ml bottle in Jerusalem, bb 11/10/17. Pours out dark brown from the bottle and looks outstanding in the glass: two to three fingers of frothy tan head that sticks around and laces as at it settles (5). Aroma is so strong I can smell it from a meter away, and thats with the runny nose Ive had the past week. Up close its a rich chocolaty, fudgy smell, like chocolate fudge ice cream. Some vanilla, cardboard, alcohol (8, because actually not picking up coffee). My goodness, the taste is super rich: thick gooey chocolate fudge up front thats really slow to fade, mildly bitter coffee finish with some alcohol (9). Cant fault the palate for anything: chewy and comfortably carbonated (5). What a delicious drink, great to slosh around in the mouth and savor each gulp anew, a dangerous beer to keep in the house (19)!
Black color. Nice, beige head . Aroma of coffee, roasted malt and... window detergent (probably a spoiled bottle). Surprisingly great taste with lot of coffee and strong roasted bitterness.

Robe noire et opaque, la mousse ne tient pas. Arômes café et fumé. Goût café puissant, notes de vanille. On reste sur du chocolat en bouche avec une amertume plutôt soutenue. Lamertume et le café restent en bouche. 
Très bon Stout.
Great beer. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts, mild taste with medium to low bittenress and accents of coffee and roast.

Pours dark brown, almost black with tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, brown sugar, not so powerful. Flavour quite the same with little coffee forward, dark chocolate and dark malts. Finish is bitter roasty and green coffee beans. Medium body, thin texture. Decent.
Intense coffee beans, dark chocolate, prunes, vanilla, all the goodness of the perfect espresso stout.
Draft - Intense dark chocolate. Jet black brown with a nice brown head. Bittersweet chocolate, espresso and a long finish. Solid.

Bottle. Black colour, average beige head with decent lacing. Aroma of coffee, espresso, cocoa, bitter chocolate and some caramel. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter - sweet chocolate and cocoa followed by strong roasty taste of coffee, espresso. Long bitter coffee finish. Medium+ body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Wonderful, intense coffee stout.

Bottle. Pours a black body with a medium creamy off-white head. Nose is coffee, caramel, mocca, dark chocolate and hints of grains, espresso and cocoa. Taste is cocoa, espresso, dark chocolate and hints of coffee, dark berries and caramel. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Nice and pretty straight-forward coffee stout, very enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Almost black with big thick beige head, stays long. Roasty, lots of good coffee beans, bitter chocolate, very dark prunes, hint of vanilla in aroma. Medium-sweet, roasty, dark chocolate in taste. Long finish is bitter chocolate and some espresso beans. Smooth medium carbonation, rather oily texture, full body, alcohol is well covered. Very enjoyable stout!
Bottle at home. Pours black with medium sized beige head. Aroma is roasted coffee and cocoa. Taste is bitter espresso with roastiness and caramel. This is a solid coffee stout!
A terific example of what a strong coffee can do to a stout. Adds a graniness to the beer and amplifies the chocolate notes. A brilliant strong stout.

Schönes Dunkel im Glas, brauner Schaum, etwas sehr feinperlig. In der Nase wundervolle Kaffeenoten und Schokolade. Im Trunk cremig, deutlich Kaffee und Schokolade - cremig bitterer Abgang, lange anhaltend. Wow. Spitzenklasse!

33cl bottle from boxbeers.dk. Pours almost black with a medium to big beige head. Aroma is fresh, vanilla, nuts some orange, caramel and herbs, and roasted coffee. Taste is sweet, with notes of toffee/caramel and dark chocolate and espresso. Bitter finish, rich and tasty stout. NICE!

Bardzo przyjemny aromat, jest lekko palony, ale też rodzynkowy. Potem bardzo intensywna zimna kawa. 
W smaku lekko kwaskowe, gorzkawe. 
Trochę gorzkiego karmelu i sporo kawy. Są nuty gorzkiej czekolady. Jest też wanilia.
Alkoholu nie czuć w ogóle. Nie ma go w smaku. Grzanie pojawia się w przełyku po dłuższej chwili. 
Bardzo dobre piwo.
Bottle. Pours deep brown with a large brown head which slowly recedes. Aroma is coffee and vanilla. Taste is caramel sweet, coffee bitter, cocoa powder, vanilla sweet, cocoa bitter.
Lots of sharp coffee and big roast like fat cannibals. Pours black with hood head and lacing. Bitter finish with hint of caramel. Good stuff. Bottle.

Zapach średnio intensywny, paloność, kakao, czekolada, kawa, suszone owoce. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana beżowa, średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, paloność, kawa, czekolada, lukrecja, kakao. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.
(En fût à Hitachino Brewing Lab): Riche mocha, corps protéiné, touche anisée, bel équilibre et haute buvabilité. Une cousine de la Founders Breakfast Stout.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Pitch black, dark mocha head. Rich coffee aroma, tons of coffee flavoured candies with nice sticky sweetness somewhere in the background. Surprisingly dry and bitter taste - the malts are barely there, strong espresso with a pleasant well roasted coffee bean acidity, lingering well into the finish. Smooth easy-drinking body. Excellent.
Aroma: roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee. Pours dark color with medium brown head. Flavor of coffee and chocolate. Bitter, very bitter.

Aroma: bitter chocolate, coffee, sweet malt
Taste: rich coffee notes. Distinctive bitter chocolate iwth slightly tart aftertaste
Very good stout
Очень вкусный стаут, отличны& аромат, красива& пена, отличны& кофейны& вкус и послевк& Срок годност& до 08.2018. (Bottle 0,330/ 7%)

Bottle bought at Library Cafe in Kanchanaburi, Thailand. I was pretty amazed to find craftbeers in Thailand. I decided to grab this one and I didnt regret it. Dark chocolate and coffee smells. Delightful mix of roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee beans, small notes of dark fruits. First beer tasted from Japan. Amazing!

Celestial good smell of coffee and sweetness. The flavor is coffee and dark chocolate. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Wonderful beer but loses flavor after a while. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Piwo ma ciemnobrunatną barwę, pod światło pojawia się trochę rubinowych przebysków. Piana jest beżowa, obfita, zbudowana z małych oczek, po opadnięciu pozostawia kożuch na powierzchni oraz odrobinę zdobień na ściankach. A aromacie przeważa czekolada, kakao, jest trochę kawy, ale raczej skrytej z tyłu. W smaku to już kawa pojawia się na pierwszym planie, towarzyszy jej przyjemna paloność przechodząca w delikatną kwaskowatość na finiszu. Goryczka zaznaczona jest wyraźnie, jest bardzo przyjemna, ma profil palono-czekoladowy. Alkoholu nie czuć, bardzo dobrze przykryty. Wysycenie jest na średnim poziomie, mam wrażenie, że jest odrobinę za wysokie. Piwo jest dość gęste, choć nie oleiste, delikatnie obkleja podniebienie, ma bardzo solidną, konkretną pełnię słodową. Piwo jest generalnie słodkie w odczuciu, goryczka na końcu nie dominuje, stanowi jedynie kontrę dla tej czekoladowej słodyczy. Bardzo dobry Stout, zresztą pozycja w Top-50 w stylu (21. miejsce) na Ratebeerze nie może być przypadkiem przy tak dużej ilości ocen. Warto było tego spróbować!

From the bottle poured into Spiegelau snifter. Pours pitch black with thick brown head. Nose is roasted malts and intense coffee. Taste is also intense coffee and roasted barley. Finish is hoppy roasty... Nice but kind of bitter...  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Has a nice coffee undertone to it. Also has a dark chocolate taste to it. Pretty good.
330 ml bottle from Alko, Mariehamn. Black with tanned head. Roasted with a lot of coffee, dried fruit and paprika. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Backlog, Bottle in 09 from Canals shared with some friends, Pours black with a creamy beige top. Notes are licorice, chocolate, toasty malt, espresso bean and blackberry. Carbonation was medium on a lighter body especially for a stout.

Zapach jest bardzo intensywny i łączy w sobie łagodną kawę, czekoladę deserową, nuty palone i nieco orzechów. W smaku piwo jest niesamowicie łagodne i aksamitnie kremowe. Nuta kawowa rzecz jasna przewodzi, ale subtelnie uzupełniają ją ciemne owoce, toffi i palone słody. Początkowo lekko słodkawe ciało pozostawia wytrawny finisz i przyjemną wyraźną gorycz. Boskie.

Botella. Absolutamente negra opaca. Espuma densa aunque no muy abundante. Aroma tostadito a café, chocolate e higo. Qué barbaridad en gusto y postgusto... infinidad de matices. Parece como si se mezclaran todos los clásicos en una stout y según la degustas aparece un sabor distinto. Pasas, chocolate, café, tabaco, caramelo,... Redondeado con un postgusto ligeramente amargo y que te invita a más. Muy buena.

0.33 bottle. <i/>  Pitch black color and a huge, tanned, creamy head. Aroma of coffee, dark fruits, some vegetables, and a tad of dark chocolate. Taste is malty, coffee obviously dominates, but chocolate can be felt too, other flavors are not notable. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a flat carbonation. Finish is bitterer and primarily based on coffee, no surprise here. Overall the beer is rather simple, not bad but by no means amazing. I have never been a big fan of coffee stouts though.

Bottle from Tap East, Westfield Stratford. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Quite heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Full body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Dry, semi-sweet finish.

- schöner Schaum, welcher allerdings schnell verfliegt
- schwarze Farbe und eine leicht ölige Konsistenz
- Aromen nach Kaffee/Espresso, Bitterschokolade, Grapefruit und etwas Gewürz
- der Antrunk wird logischerweise von der Espresso-Note sofort beherrscht
- im Mittelteil kommen die Gewürze und eine leichte Fruchtigkeit noch hinzu
- die gegen Ende einsetzende leichte Rauchnote rundet das Ganze perfekt ab 
Fazit: Absolutes Hammer Stout

Pours a very dark brown with a dark taupe head. Vegetable matter suspended in the liquid and only visible in the more narrow portion of the glass. Coffee and strong notes of green olive on the nose. Thick, slightly powdery mouthfeel. Sweetness is enveloped by bitterness perfectly. Coffee, chocolate, and cherry flavors are evident. The best stout Ive had in a while. What a nice surprise.

Bouteille 33cl. Noire, mousse foncée peu résistante. Superbe nez de café torréfié, chocolat, biscuit, fruits noirs, réglisse. Excellent expresso doux en bouche et vanille, chocolat, amertume moyenne de bon aloi. Excellente ! Nabusez pas si vous voulez bien dormir car on ne sait pas si le breuvage est décaféiné :-)

Black body with some creamy, brown head. Quite mild aroma, roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla and coffee. Roasty taste, malty, finish has some coffee as well. Medium body, smooth carbonation, creamy, soft mouthfeel. Very nice stout with a lots of coffee.

Bottle from maruhn. Pours pitch black with brown head, looks like a coffee with cream ontop. Nose is coffee, toffee, chocolate, dried fruit. Palate is immidiately full of coffee and tart, earthy bread notes. Finish is long and bitter. Beautifully Balanced. This is a stout with Extras done right.

Bottle. Dark brown close to black with a medium/large dark brown head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Nose has espresso, minerals, chalk, light flowers. Smells good. Flavour comprises of roasted malt, espresso, bitter chocolate, light chalk and floral notes. Medium/full body, oily texture, some sweetness matched by pleasant roasted bitterness and mild acidity. Flavourful and well balanced.
Bottle. Dark colour, slim light brown head. Cafe, roasted, light caramel. Medium malty, light bitter. One of the first stout I love

33cl bottle. Black with big, beige head. The aroma is quite fresh for a stout. Lots of nuts, vanilla, orange peel, coca-cola like caramel and herbs. Also lots of toffee and roasted coffee with lots of milk. Nice. The mouth feel has an aggressive carbonation but its creamy and fluffy. The taste is quite sweet with notes of toffee/caramel and dark chocolate. It gets more and more roasted into dark chocolate like bitterness. The finish is getting bitter but still not overpowering the sweetness. There is also some hints of fresh espresso acidity. Overall its a rich and tasty stout. Something I could come back to.
Pours a dark brown to black with a thick foamy tan head. Nice coffee aroma. Medium to thick body texture. Taste is coffee but not too overpowering. Fairly enjoyable.
Bottle @ home, from Voldby. Black pour with a frothy light tan head. Notes of espresso, bitter coffee, tons of ash, dry bitter chocolate, light caramel, licorice and some roast.

Bottle shared with friends. Pitch black with a medium beige head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Tasty bitterness with subtle sweet tones. Roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, some brown sugar, caramel and spices. Very tasty!

Bottle: 330 ml, Price : 1,20 eur. 
Juodas. Didele ruda puta, malonus kvapas... skonis nuvylė

Bottle. Aroma of espresso, dark chocolate, figs, roast, tobacco. 
Pours out almost pitch black, beige creamy head. 
Taste has loads of dark chocolate and espresso on the back. Nice toasty and malty character. 
Medium plus body, soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel, espresso and toasty finish. Good stuff!

Pite z okazji przebicia 500 spróbowanych piw, pierwszy wpis na ratebeer. Piwo bardzo dobre, ale tylko tyle. Oczekiwałem jednak więcej. Spodziewałem się więcej kawy, tymczasem wyraźnie odznacza się ona tylko w zapachu. W smaku jest bardziej likierowo - coś na kształt wiśnia/śliwka w czekoladzie. Raczej jednowymiarowo. Czuć alkohol ciut. A i co ciekawe - jest miejscami lekko przejrzyste, ma rubinowe refleksy. Ogólnie być może moja butelka źle zniosła trudy przechowywania i tyle.

Casi negra, casi opaca. Bonita espuma ocre consistente y duradera. Intenso aroma café recién molido. Cremosa entrada en boca, con buen punto de gas. Compleja en el sabor, con notas ácidas frutales, vainilla, café y chocolate y amargor notable. Muy sabrosa. Redonda.

Noire dencre, petit collet persistant.
Aromes extra fort de marc de cafe, reglisse, liqueur
Bien ronde mais pas pesante, une finale cafe amere et seche comme il faut
Longueur bien marquée

Bottle from Alko. Pours black with light brown creamy head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and dark fruits. Taste is sweet, bitter, with lots of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Very smooth and enjoyable, very good brew indeed!

Bottle. Black with light brown head. Aroma of coffee, brown sugar, chocolate, prunes and roasted malts. Sweet flavour with notes of chocolate and dark fruit, brown sugar and quite a lot of coffee ending with a roasted bitter finish. Enjoyable.

Practically black, thin brown head, good lacing. Sweet and mildly bitter aroma, lots of coffee, nice natural coffee aroma, bit mocca, vanilla, very inviting aroma. Full body, soft carbonation, dry and nicely roasted, pure coffee, long finish, salty licorice. Very good, pure flavors, tasty. For the ones who enjoy a cup of "damn good coffee".
Im a beginner, so I dont have a detailed comment, but I like this beer a lot.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Pours black with a medium brown head, nice lacing. Loads and loads of coffee and chocolate in the aroma, some toffee and dried fruit and cookies. Taste is assertively roasty bitter and acidic, with medium sweetness slightly behind. Medium body and carbonation, texture resembles coffee, somewhat sticky. Lip smacking goodness!

Bottle in wine glass. Pours medium plus dark brown with a two finger head. Aroma has coffee for sure and the taste is just simple roasted stout with hints of vanillaish toffee coffee. Overrated but good.

Aroma: Roasted malt with sweet vanilla and coffee. 
Flavour: Roasted coffee with vanilla, sweet fruits and fruity bitterness. Dry bitter finish.
Colour: Pitch black with a brown head. 
From: Bottle @ FLASK Aarhus Jul. 2016.

330ml. Bottle @home. Pours black with tiny brown head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, dryed fruits, caramel and notes of vanilla. 
Body has a high carbonation with a thin texture. Taste of coffee, caramel, roasted malt, kind of spicy in a way and aftertaste has a medium bitterness. Too weak body in my opinion.
Stark karbonisierter Antrunk. Deutliche Noten von Espresso, süß malzig milde Herbe. Minimal bitter, dann trockener werdend, sehr weich. Spritzig. 9/11/11/10/11/11

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours dark brown with big brown head. Nose is roasted coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, blackcurrants. Tastes coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits. Quite fizzy, medium sweet and medium bodied. Good coffee stout.

Bottle. Pours black with highlights, fizzy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, coffee rising as it opens up, milk or vanilla, a lighter citrus hop note. Great flavour of roasted malt, milk-tinged coffee, chocolate, a touch of fruit tang. Nice full stout body but carried by a refreshing tingle of carbonation. Lasting malt sweetness. Really good, itd been too long since Id last had one.

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque black with a medium, creamy, long lasting, brown head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit and vanilla. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate and vanilla with a bitter coffee finish. Medium body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Tasty.
330ml bottle. Black body with a medium head. Fruit, coffee, vanilla, roasted malt. Some cabbage.
en botella 33 cl. Excelente stout con gran presencia de cafe. Ligera y suave, ideal para combinar con tus postres
Bottle from Voldby. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich coffee, rich roast malt, chocolate, vegetables, caramel and hops. Nice dry coffee finish.

Pours black colour with quite a lot of head. Flavor has dark coffee, roasted malts, a bit caramelly, some cocoa. Medium or even a bit thick body, pleasant aftertaste lasts for a moment. Balanced and easy to drink even with quite thick body.

Bottle. Pours in black body with low tan head. Heavy yeast sediment. Aroma has caramel at first, light grainy background, high coffee aroma, no hop aroma. Taste has medium caramel sweetness, coffee background, coffee beans in the after taste. Low earthy bitterness. Low astringency. Body is full, heavy, medium-low carbonation.

Rating # 2500. 33 cl bottle @ home, bbe May 2016. Black color. Uneven light brown head. Aromas of red fruit (candies), with some coffee. Much more (ground) coffee and roast retronasal, some sweetness, some fruit. Flavor is only light sweet, roasted, light roasty sourness. Light to medium bodied. Finish is roasted, coffee, a bit dry, but hardly bitter.

Black and full-bodied. Full coffee aroma and flavour, with a more moderate malt profile. Some vanilla notes. Somewhat dry taste with moderate bitterness. Overall, a great coffee stout. It is noticably less sweet and bitter than other beers of this kind, but it is still tasty and strikes a good balance.

Bottle 330ml. Aroma: Coffee beans and coffee in general, at the back some chocolate. Color is black, head - medium, tan. Flavour: Coffee, later chocolate and some oxidation notes (cherries, plums). Chocolate aftertaste. Taste is sourish and only slight sweet. Bitterness is quite high, roasty. Body is light, texture slick. Soft carbonation. Overall: Great coffee! But the beer lack complexity and some typical stout notes, as chocolate and roasty note. For me also not enough body

Bottle from Cornelius. Black body with a thick tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of coffee beans, cocoa powder and charred wood. Flavour of creamy chocolate, berries and a tangy espresso. Medium body with a slick texture. Soft carbonation. It doesnt quite have the depth and richness I was hoping for, but this is a solid beer.

Bottle
Pours in dark brown, nearly black with a brown head, quickly disappearing.
You can smell some coffee, little malt.
Creamy In the mouth there is the coffee like an espresso shot, little chocolate and toffee.
Nice, not much roast and a lot of coffee flavours.

Pours dark brown, almost black with a coffee brown head. Aroma is not that strong,a little bit of coffee, malt and caramel. But the taste, wow, really delivers the espresso flavor with a hint of pure chocolat. The oily mouthfeel goes really well with that. Really good. Plus I could drink enough of these to get drunk.

Bottle from Borough Wines, Kensal Rise/Queens Park, consumed at home cooking a LambTagine Monday 30th May 2016   Pours black with a tan head, the aroma is a little bit beefy, not getting so much coffee on the nose. However in the mouth the coffee shows, there is a nice cool cappuccino flavour going on, its creamy, not too roasty a nice beer. A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov15 3.7
Pours dark with minimal head. Bitter aroma. Medium mouthfeel with a spicy kick. Doesnt compare with any other beer. Well done. Bottle.

Super Stout. Zlozony, niesamowity i wyrazisty. Zblizony do RIS. Ciemne czekoladowe i smoliste piwo z ciemno bezowa spora kremowa piana, trwala w dodatku. Slodowosc, nuty palone, słodycz i wytrawna palonosc na przemian się uzupelniaja przy każdym lyku. Oleista struktura, lepkie, trochę jagod i owocow leśnych, jeżyny. Bardzo dobry zlozony Stout. Polecam

20.05.2016 İstanbul, Şişe.

Görüntü: simsiyah renkli, köpük kahverengi, kremamsı, çok hafif bir kızıllık var, kalıcı değil, ince bir tabaka hakim.

Koku: soğuk olmasına rağmen daha bardağa boşaltırken vanilya, çikolata, vişnemsi-kirazımsı meyve kokuları hissediliyor. Tabi kahve, espresso da ön olanda.

Tadım: kahve, çikolata, kırmızı meyveler (vişne, kiraz), espresso.. Dolgun, damakta kompleks, kahve tınıları kalıcı ve keyifli.

Genel değerlendirme; oldukça kompleks, keyifli, dolgun ve damağı saran, uzun süre kalıcı içimiyle çok çok iyi bir Stout!

330 ml bottle from Hawthorne Cellars. Pours black with dark tan head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Very present coffee flavour with carmel and toffee. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared by Jan, thanks. Lightly lacing, creamy, pale beige head, blackish robe but actually dark burgundy, translucent in the end. Lovely aroma of indeed espresso, bitter chocolate, cocoa nibs, vanilla, roasted peanuts, natural iron, fig, bayleaf, dried blackberry, dry earth. Soft, clean, restrainedly sweetish onset with equally soft sourish and umami flavors, some dried fruit, softish carbo, full and somewhat oily body, nutty and toasted malt bittersweetness evolving into coffeeish roasted bitterness in which the espresso is well integrated: both interact and the latter provides a wonderfully spicy, aromatic coffee bean sensation, carried upwards by some warming, brown rum-like alcohol; a bit earthy and ever so slightly metallic as well. Very well crafted stout and surely the best Japanese beer I had so far.

Bottle shared at home. Espresso dark brown with thin creme head. Sweet chocolate malts, ground coffee beans, espresso, hazelnut. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Full body, thick round feel, dry cocoa/coffee bitterness. Low to no carbonation. Coffee taste is nice but a bit like old coffee, still quite dense but nothing like fresh espresso.
Bottle, thanks PotjeBier! Deep dark brown color. Malt, indeed espresso and a hint of cacao in the aroma. Malty sweet, soft roasty espresso flavor with a hint of licorice. Raisin. Pleasant.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 330ml bottle. Pours black with a good two-finger brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit, touch of vanilla. Flavour is the same with roasted malts and a lovely coffee hit, with chocolate and dark fruit notes. Good carbonation and creamy smooth mouthfeel, bitter. Fantastic brew.

Nez: Café, chocolat
Bouche: Café, chocolat, fruits noirs, vanille liquoreuse
Un Stout de toute beauté. <3
A wispy stout like Porterhouse would brew; espresso, cocoa and iced milk coffee on the (dry) finish; classy, imperial-esque stuff.
Semmoistahan tämä on. Kovasti on kahvia. Suutuntuma on kyllä mukava. Hiilihappoa rutkasti. Hyvä valinta, mutta synkempään talveen.

Clear black with small tan, quite big carbonation. Aroma: heavy roasted coffee. Taste: after smelling i thought it would be dominated by coffe, but its nicely balanced. Theres also some roastiness and cocoa. Not to dry, oily texture, quite drinkable. I thougt its regular stout, but (according to bjcp guidline) its in upper limit of fes.

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Kolding. Pours opaque black with a large, frothy beige head. Aroma has coffee, chocolate, cocoa, light sugar. Medium, prickly carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, light black currants astringency, coffee and chocolate. Good malty dry bitterness. Very drinkable.

Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts and chocolate. Semi sweet at first but then turns medium to strong bitter. Body is medium-full with smooth mouthfeel. Finish is dry and bitter.

Bottle, 11.2 fl.oz. Home. A dark brown nearly black shining beer with a medium beige foamy head ; medium retention. Coffee (++), chocolate, herb, roast. Medium sweet, round, warming, light dry bitter fresh wind. Medium body, average texture, silky, average to soft carbonation, coffee ice-cream light bitter finish. Overall, a delicious roasty coffee bittersweet beer ; impressive for 7.5% abv.
Bottle at home. Pours black with a large tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and liquorice. Tastes is coffee, dark chocolate, smooth, molasses, brown sugar sweetness, slight raisin.

330ml bottle served in regular glass. Purchased Craftissimo - Hong Kong.
A: Pours a dark brown to black color forming a big creamy beige head with good retention and some soapy lacings formed and left in the glass.
S: Nose is sweet and roasted. Strong notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. Grassy hops.
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of toffee, caramel malts, roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. Medium bitterness. Good combination of roasted malts and grassy hops composing its bitterness. In overall,, a slightly sweet taste.
M: Medium creamy body. Medium carbonation. Roastiness, dark chocolate and coffee in the aftertaste.
O: Good drinkability. Great brew.

0.33 l bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Dark brown colour with a tan head. Aroma is malty. Taste has oily malts and some tartness. This is very well balanced - not just plain sweet or dry. I like tha fact they didnt use roasted barley but instead roasted malts.

Bottle. Luxurious big-bubbled tan head and oil-black body. Not heavily carbonated. Deep coffee aromas and flavors. While coffee predominates, there is a lot of malt complexity here - more than most imperial stouts without much alcohol pushing through. A dry, flavorful, satisfying beer.

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, lekko zmętniony.
Piana: obfita, drobno oraz średnio pęcherzykowa, trwała.
Zapach: sporo kawy, trochę ciemnego pieczywa oraz ciemnych owoców, karmelu, czekolady.
Smak: pełnia dość niska, sporo kawy, trochę ciemnych owoców, kakao, gorzkiej czekolady, lekkie akcenty ciemnego pieczywa, goryczka średnia w kierunku niskiej, kawowa.
Wysycenie: średnie, w kierunku wysokiego.

Bottle from secret santa Saeglopur, many thanks! Pours black with a beige head. Espresso, coffee grounds, dark chocolate, vanilla, roast. Light sweet, medium bitter, slight sourness, oily texture, medium body. Lingering, slightly astringent finish. Nice.

Sampled from a bottle, the beer poured black with a milky coffee coloured foamy head. The head lasted a while before leaving a cap on the beer and lacing down the glass. The aroma contained acidic coffee, dark chocolate, floral hops, dark fruits (prunes and black currants), liquorice, and roasted malts. The flavour was coffee forward, with the tastes of acidity espresso beans, notes of chocolate, vanilla dark fruits and berries, roasted malts and molasses. The finish was dry and pleasantly bittered with earthy peppery floral hops. A little warming alcohol was also noted. The stout was full flavoured and robust, but smooth at the same time. The beer was lightly carbonated and creamy.

Bottle.

A- Chocolate, roasty, subtle dark fruits, subtle iron.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Chocolate, tootsie rolls, coffee, slightly sweet, slight roasted bitterness.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

O- For being an espresso/coffee forward stout, its surprisingly mundane and actually holds much more chocolate flavor. Good stuff but maybe not as rich or robust as it could be.
Kept sipping at this thinking I must be missing something its ok but top 50 stout surprised, dark chocolate coffee roastiness is spot on bit gritty in the palate ok but not outstanding.

330 ml bottle. Black, with a thin tan head. Sweetish aroma of milk chocolate, roasted malt and mocha. The flavour is sweetish roasted malty, with cocoa and coffee, and a dryish roasted bitter finish. Very tasty.

L:
-pours the darkest of brown with no light coming through and a medium,foamy,beige head
S:
-oats,coffee,hazelnuts,molasses,milk chocolate
T:
-espresso,mocha,licorice,earthy,,oa carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Great Coffee Stout
Piwo bardzo ciemne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana dosyć bujna. Aromat miał być kawowy i jest, ale raczej w typie kawy zielonej, a nie espresso. W smaku trochę palone, odrobinę ziemiste, generalnie bez szału.

From 12 oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a nice dark dark brown, nearly black with a thick brown head. Nose is a little more faint than I had hoped, nonetheless you have chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, dark fruits. Medium heavy body, kind of a surprise at first since you expect such a huge and heavy beer but this is nicely balanced. Super silky mouth feel, finishes nice and crisp on the palate. Awesome beer, really like the complexity with the espresso.

Barwa ciemno brunatna, prawie czarna. Piękna drobno-pęcherzykowa beżowa piana, która z czasem się redukuje. 
W zapachu tony kawy. Niby piwo gotowane było z ziarnami kawy, ale mi aromat bardziej kojarzy się z fusiastą kawą zalewaną. Nic poza tym nic nie wyczułem. Kawa przesłania wszystko 
W smaku wyraźna kawowa kwaskowość, a po przełknięciu pozostaje lekka goryczka. Alkohol prawie niewyczuwalny, lekko tylko rozgrzewa przełyk, ale dopiero po kilku łykach. 
Piwo dość pełne, jednak nie jest to imperialny syrop kawowy.

Pitch black color, nice & beige head. Sweet aroma, lot of chocolate, roastness, dark bread, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is very good balanced, mix of sourness, roastness and sweetness. Some fruits, more coffee then aroma and dark chocolate.

Ah ben ça cest un bon stout! Un grand merci à moi-même pour cette découverte dune magnifique représentante de son style! Un liquide bien foncé sans être parfaitement noir. Une mousse de couleur crème se forme doucement en surface alors que les bulles remontent tranquillement en un majestueux tourbillon. La tête formée, le liquide stabilisé, lensemble est irréprochable. Un nez où le café fort est à lhonneur! Une torréfaction de café français, presque vanillé où je relève des notes de mocha, de gâteau au chocolat (du gâteau Opéra pour être plus précis) avec son grain de café sur le glaçage. En bouche le liquide est un peu mince mais malgré son manque de densité, le liquide est bien amer dune torréfaction juste et précise. Aucune fumée, rien de brûlé, que des malts noircis et grillés à point. Le côté chocolat tombe sous lamertume. Je sens une eau pure coulant dune rivière sauvage et fraîche. Une bière magnifique!

Black beer, tanned creamy head with minimal lacing. 
Aroma: coffe, dark chocolate, hint of licorish-nutty thing, pretty good and intence.
Taste: light sweet, very light sour, medium roasted bitter. Flavours of dark chocolate, coffe, licorish-nutty thing again.
Palate: medium body, low saturation, long finish with dark chocolate and coffe notes.
Overall: Very nice beer.

Asahiya hooked my wife and I up with this Valentines Label version of their Espresso Stout 7% which is the highest rated Japanese Brew.
It pours a dark black with a lovely rusty tan head. A creamy ground espresso bean aroma entices.
Fairly full bodied with a somewhat dry finish. The taste is espresso with a light sweetness then bitter dark chocolate and roastiness. Very solid stuff.

Bottle to taster
Consummation: Smoky and umami coffee.
Adjunct: Very creamy, bitter, dark chocolate.

Bottle. Opaque black color with quite thick tanned head. Aroma has caramel, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste is malty with quite long a bit bitter and not so sweet finish. Flavors of coffee, black currant, roasted or even burned malt, dark chocolate. Excellent one.
Espresso? Oh, es indeed. You can feel coffee and rostate taste overal solid stout beer.
Schwarz mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Röstmalzig, reichlich Kaffee, bitter, etwas Vanille, dunkle Schokolade, würzig.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 It is a good beer, we can smell the coffee, interesting beer nice black color and brown foam. There is an interesting side bitter and of course the coffee nespresso is giving a nice side "onctueux". It is a stout not so ordinary and I was astonished to find this beer in the pibar at the tap.
very nice and rich on coffee flavours and aromas. quite light as a stout usually is and some sweetness. roasted.
Strong coffee smell and the taste is like a party in your mouth!!

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2016 Aroma: coffee!

Appearance: black

Taste: strong coffee 

Palate: full body, thick 

Overall: Day - Columbia bean Latte, once in a blue moon Night - Hitachino Espresso
Pitch black with brown foam and a nice taste of coffee. Nose is coffee and sweet chocolate. Would have scored even better if it wasnt for the irritating sour aftertaste.

Inpenatratable balck color with medium gira/kvass color foam. Aromas of sweet coffee, cocoa, hot chocholate and chocholate truffels. Palate, full body with ritch, thick and full texture. Carbonation wise it has bit of a fizz on the tongue and leaves nice sweet coffee finish. Taste is sweet at start and has nice coffee bitter finish to it. Tastes of coffee and black chocolate. Over all nice coffee stout, with full flavour and it is not watery as some others which is good. Would recomend it!

Si presenta nel bicchiere di colore marrone scuro, torbido; la schiuma è imponente, cremosa, fine, per colore e forma ricorda un vero espresso. Laroma è possente di caffè, torrefazione, cioccolato, liquirizia, malto e caramello. Lingresso in bocca è favoloso: carattere di caffè espresso, caramello, malto tostato e cioccolato, offrono unesplosione di sapori; seguono note di vaniglia. Palato corposo, con una bassa carbonazione; finale secco ed un amaro lineare offrono una buona intensità. Arigatou!

(bottle) black in colour with a frothy light-brown head. aroma of sugar icing and grassy coffee beans, quite earthy, with some notes of roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate fudge and soy sauce. flavour is mostly caramel, roasted malts and cherry stones, with absolutely no sweetness, some notes of dried plums, more earth and a touch of ethanol in the semi-dry finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

Café, caramel, vanille, épices poivrées... tout se mèlent avec harmonie, douceur et une pointe damertume et de force.

Sublime.
Flaske. Farven er sort med en fast brun skumkrone. Aromaen og smagen er ristet malt, kaffe, nødder, chokolade og mørk frugt.

Bottle 33 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Black beer very coffee, roasted full blast, full bodied with nuances of dark cho, black berries and vanilla. Nice Stout balanced between softness and bitterness with a long finale.
Roasted coffeeish aroma, a hint of licorice. Espresso atmosphere continues in taste. Not too dry. Moderately roasted. Easy stout.

0,33l fles.Gedeeld met.bryanvdv mooie donkerbruine kleur met crème schuimkraag. Geur is donker fruit koffie en zwarte chocolade. Smaak mooi bitter.Zoet.maar ook as in de afdronk. Goede Body. Degelijk stout

Dark seal color with ruby reflections, clear. Massive beige head, its definitely over carbonated. Aroma is exactly as it introduced on the deScription - chocolate, roasted , black currants, dark fruits notes and also whole, unmilled coffee beans. That gives nice effect, but it might be much more intensive. In the mouth feel is on the other hand almost completely flat and super soft. In the taste is the same case as in aroma. Maybe its not that rich, but still filled with nice espresso coffee, dark bitter chocolate and coffee beans. Its really good, but its a pity that its not much more intense. In overall its a great beer. Must try.

WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, wysoka, dość trwała. Oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Potężny zapach kawy. Trochę z tyłu czekolada. W tle nuty ziemisto-palone, oraz wędzona śliwka. 
SMAK: Gładki, wręcz aksamitny smak dobrej palonej kawy. Goryczka średnia, krótka. Alkohol bardzo dobrze "ułożony", idealnie komponuje się z całą resztą.
OGÓLNIE: Zdecydowanie udane i warte ponownego spróbowania. Pikanterii dodaje fakt, że mamy tutaj do czynienia z wydawałoby się egzotycznym kierunkiem na mapie "świata piw", co tylko potwierdza regułę, że dobre piwa można ważyć pod każdą szerokością geograficzną.
Tan minimal head, black liquid, aroma of coffee, taste of coffee, caramel. Medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Med body, creamy

Alkohol: 7% obj.

Kolor: Bardzo ciemny brąz.
Prawie nieprzejrzyste.

Piana: Kremowo-beżowa, drobnooczkowa, a także średniooczkowa.
Umiarkowane znaczki na szkle.
Dość wysoka trwałość.
Solidny kożuch piwny.

Zapach: Początek dość palony, ale z nutami ciemnych i czerwonych owoców: śliwki u wiśnie.
Troszeczkę karmelu i toffi.
Całość zdominowanna przez silne akcenty kawy espresso.

Smak: Mocno palony, lekko wędzony z dominantami w postaci kawy espresso - mocnej, świeżo zaparzonej. Na końcu języka szczypta wanilli.
W kontrze silne nuty owocowe, zdecydowana sugestia wiśni.
Gdzieś pośrodku tego szaleństwa nuty gorzkiej czekolady deserowej.
Na finiszu kawowy, wytrawny kwaskowaty posmak.
Goryczka średnia, kawowa.
Odczucie w ustach - gładkie, średniotreściwe.

Wysycenie: Zdecydowanie za wysokie. Bardzo duży minus.
Piwo mogłoby być dużo bardziej pijalne, gdyby zmniejszyć nagazowanie.

Podsumowanie:

Mój pierwszy w życiu kontakt z japońskim craftem.
Od razu sięgnąłem po piwo z najwyższej półki.
Jest to w tej chwili piwo No 1 na świecie w japońskim piwowarstwie rzemieślniczym.
Smak jest głęboki, gładki, kremowy, palony z silnymi wyznacznikami w podtaci świeżej kawy espresso, gorzkiej czekolady, owoców (śliwki, wiśnie), a także karmelu i wanilli.
Mały minus dla browaru za zbyt wysokie wysycenie, przez które piwo sprawia wrażenie lekko zapychającego.

Bardzo unikatowy charakter Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout wynika z faktu, że Browar Kiuchi Brewery używał receptury Russian Imperial Stouta jako bazy do tego piwa.

Zgadzam się z tym w 100% - gdyby zwiększyć trochę ekstrakt i moc procentów piwo spokojnie mogło by być lekkim RIS-em.

Bardzo dobry trunek!
From bottle. Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasty, nuts, chocolate. Taste is pretty much the same, lots of coffee and roasted notes. Light body.
Bottle. Pours deep black with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, deep roast, light roast, milky, light earthy. Taste is rather sweet, coffee, caramel.

Butelka 0,33l bączek japoński. Kolor ciemnobrązowy bez przebłysków, piana nie występuje. Aromat za to tak intensywna kawa i czekolada. Smak to kawa i jeszcze raz kawa z nutami czekolady. Łagodne na podniebieniu, super stout takie lubię.
Dark black with nice tan head and lacing. Roasted coffee malts. Really enjoyable and fresh stout. No sour lactic notes just delicious coffee and toasted malts. Delicious great stout.

0.33l bottle, courtesy of Cristobal37. Black body, beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel and cream. Taste of coffee, cream, chocolate and hints of floral hops. Medium body, creamy texture. I like it very much.
Aroma: coffee, dark fruits, dark chocolate and roasted malts. Taste: chocolate, coffee, dried dark fruits, caramel and coffee sourness on aftertaste. Nice head, good lacing and medium carbonation.

Thick continuous nougat colored foam. The aroma is light coffee and dried fruit. The taste is not quite as one would expect from a stout which is titled Espresso Stout. It is both sweet and acid at the same time, but have little influenced by the coffee towards the end. Palate is most like overcooked vegetables with a water coffee taste at the end. It is like a dry stout with its irrigated fullness and lack of malt flavor and filling fill that surname is deemed to be coffee. In the aftertaste it unfolds a little more and has a subtle coffee flavor, but it is not a stout that lives up to its name. I think its a bit boring.
Black color with creamy tan head. Aroma of coffee and dark fruits. Taste of coffee, again, roast and chocolate. Moderate dry finish. Nice.

W aromacie kawa, czekolada deserowa, troszkę brakowało głębi. Podobnie w smaku, raczej wytrawne, ciut zbyt cienkie, przede wszystkim mocna kawa niezłej jakości i mniej czekolady deserowej. Przyjemne, acz nie porywające.

Piana obfita, jasno brązowa, dośc trwała i zdobiąca szkło. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta z brązowymi refleksami. Aromat z butelki głównie czekoladowy i palony, po przelaniu do szkła na pierwszy plan zdecydowanie wychodzi kawa, świeżo mielona kawa ziarnista, intensywna i przyjemna. W smaku również kawa po turecku wiedzie prym, jest także szwajcarska czekolada i tytoń. Piwo jest pół wytrawne, pozostawia fajną popiołowość na języku, alkohol likierowy, lekko wyklejający, przy czym całość kontruje średnia, kawowo-kakaowa goryczka. Nagazowanie średnie do niskiego, dość pełne i całkiem gęste w odbiorze. 
Deserowy, intensywny i smaczny Stout, któremu bliżej do FESa czy lekkiego RISa niż sesyjnego Guinnessa (choć ze szkła zniknął bardzo szybko). Bardzo udany trunek!

Bouquet très rond : beaucoup de café et fond chocolat (lait).Bouche : un café très rond, plutôt doux. On y trouve aussi étonnamment bien un fond houblonné, assez herbal, bien équilibré avec la très légère amertume de la torréfaction et un fond boisé. Petit fond de fruits rouges doux (fraise/cerise). Une certaine épaisseur très plaisante.La longueur est très ronde, avec un café doux. Très légère amertume mais non écoeurante.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Flaska på East West, Örebro (vid releasespelning för Oh Hiroshima, kolla upp!). På sushi-restaurang är det inte annat än passande att testa lite japansk öl. Svart vätska med fingertjockt brunbeiget skum som lägger sig. Mycket soja i doften, nästan lite salt. Stor syrlig espressodoft. Även någon sötsyrlig doft av kokta grönsaker/grönsaksbuljong.  Smaken inleds ungefär desamma, för att sen ge mer utrymme åt kaffetoner. Medelstor kropp. Skön smulig kaffesump i slutet, lämnar en rund känsla i munnen.

Happy Stout Day! W aromacie bardzo fajna paloność, kawa, czekolada gorzka. W smaku bardzo fajnie uderza palonosc połaczona z goryczką, potem cudowna kawowość, dobrze dopieszczona nutą kwaskowata. Naprawde wysmienicie oddany profil espresso. Takie piwa mozna pic i pić.

Black beer with big fluffy head in beige colour. Aroma has espresso coffee, some herbs and grassy notes. Taste has lots of espresso coffee, dry roasted malts. Dry coffee stout. Medium body with a bit too high carbonation to my taste.

Aroma of coffee, liquirice, chocolate, roasty, smoke and a bit citrus. Black with a brown head. Medium sweet with a medium bitter finish for the style. Taste of coffee, chocolate and liquirice. Lively carbonation, full body, long finish. Good beer from Japan!

Denne espresso stout har et meget sort udseende med et tykt mørkt skum. Øllen smager kraftigt igennem af kaffe og har noter af karamel, lakrids og lidt frisk citrus. Desuden er den meget cremet. Medium karbonering.
Bottle, thanks bluus. Pours a dark brown with a decent, latte-colored head. Aroma is coffee and roast. Taste is a strong, dark roast espresso; roast and coffee. Dry and full.

Aromat: na pierwszym miejscu kawa espresso, następnie czekolada, , kakao, zboże i sporo estrów.


Wygląd: barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana ciemno beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, obfita i dosyć trwała. 


Smak: słodko z nutą kwaskową i wytrawna kawa. Następnie kakao, czekolada gorzka i mleczna, suszone owoce, lekki alkohol oraz paloność. Goryczka raczej słodowa, poniżej średniej, wyczuwalna, ale niezbyt mocna czy długa. Krągła pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie, palony i odrobinę kwaskowy finisz z nutą alkoholową, ale przyjemną. Bardzo przyzwoite piwo.

Bottle. 7.0%. Best before 08.16. Pours a dark brown, bordering black, with a creamy tan head. Sweet, soft roasted aroma. Weak hint of soy sauce. Dark fruit notes as well as light dusty and bread notes as it warms. Flavour is sweetish with a tart overtone. Roasted. Light bread note, hint of hops. Bitter, somewhat tart finish. Overall okay, well-balanced, but nothing special; a bit boring actually. Not getting any coffee either. 28.10.15.
Dark brown. Aroma: roasted, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste: coffee, well balanced, pleasent aftertaste. Alcohol well hidden.
From bottle. Pours black with medium brown head. Chocolate, wood, ash, coffee, sweet but kinda dry, warming alcohol. Really good.

330ml bottle at home, served in a tulip. Almost black, with a bubbly tan head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate - I had a memory flash of Cadburys "Old Jamaica", so perhaps a hint of rum and raisin. Flavours are like a bowl with a scoop each of high end rum and raisin , vanilla, and coffee ice cream. Nicely balanced bittersweet taste. Creamy mouth feel. A bit of a treat. The morning after, Im sniffing - no, inhaling the bottle, and enjoying happy memories.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BBE 09/2016, from Alko Arkadia, 20151009) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized, lightly brown and it lasted long. Aroma had burnt malts, coffee and creaminess. Palate was medium bodied and fizzy. Flavours were burnt malts, coffee, sweetness, hops and bitterness. Aftertaste had coffee, burnt malts and bitterness. A good coffee infused stout.

Bottle, 7% ABV. Deep brown-black with a nice tan head. Pleasant aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and cocoa. Medium-sweet with rich flavors of chocolate, prunes, coffee, vanilla, berries, perfect balance. Rather full bodied, silky smooth texture. Great stout.

Bottle sample, thanks zvsn. 7% abv. Deep brown with small brownish head. The aroma has lots of coffee, dark chocolate and minerals, a bit creamy. Sweetish flavor with lots of coffee, some minerals, some roastiness, light bitterness, hint of vanilla and some fruitiness, light sourness in the finish. Soft carbonation, medium to full-bodied. Very good stout.

Bottle, bb 5.2016. Pours almost black, with ruby-coloured hue and large, beige, creamy head. Strong aroma of coffee, and roasted malts. Deep taste of coffee, slightly sour, only lightly sweet, with marked bitterness. Medium bodied, with average carbonation. Decent coffee stout.

Pours black, small, dark head fades fast. Smell is espresso, indeed. Ok intensity. Taste is espresso, but in a very balanced, not overpowering manner. I like it a lot, even though I disslike coffee very much. It has that... Bad taste. Some offeebeers have it, some dont. This one hasnt , but has got all the good essence of coffee a stout can have. In the background are dark malts, and a bitterness. The aftertaste reminds of chocolat and coffee. All together, this is a very nice balanced beer, with very full flavor and yet -by compare - low abv. Lovely !

Hell of a good coffee stout, this one. Toasty, roasty, with lots and lots of coffee packed in there, and more of the bitterness coming from the coffee than any hops. Tastes a little burnt, but oh well. A nice coffee stout!

Bottle from Alko. Pours very dark brown with medium light brown head. Nose has very burnt malt, dark chocolate, coffee and black licorice aromas. Bitter dark chocolate with hints of coffee and roast malt. Light body with a creamy milk-like texture and soft carbonation.

Pours dark brown with average creamy light brown head. Good lacing. Aroma is malty, cookie, espresso, nuts, roasted malts, spruce, red berries, earth. Notes of vanilla and licorice. Flavor is medium malty, light bitter, short aftertaste. Body is medium, palate is oily, carbonation is soft. Thin experience, alas.
Aronma is really nice tos aroma with lots of espresso beans. Taste is balan ed sweetness and bitterness. Light dry finish. Palate is light for a stout. Taste should be stronger.
Bottle@ølmesse, Voldby (29-08-15). Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma and taste is toasted malts, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Medium body. Creamy mouthfeel. Roasty bitter finish. Good.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Medium aroma of bitter coffee, dark chocolate and hint of vanilla. Dark brown/black color with medium light beige head. Medium/strong taste of dominating bitter coffee. After firs bite comes roasted malts and chocolate in balanced fashion. Wide taste spectrum and long, malty bit bitter aftertaste. Medium body with medium carbonation. Overall very sturdy and balanced flavors for 7.5%, but too bitter.

Bottle from Alko. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with espresso, roasted malts, licorice, wood, vanilla and dark fruits. Bitter with espresso, roasted malts, licorice, black currants and nuts. Exquisite stout.
Aroma of coffee grounds. Taste is a strong, strong espresso with a bit of sour milk and malts.

A taste from a bottle @ a friends place. Pours very dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, bitter black coffee and some alcohol. Flavor is dark roasted malts, coffee, some alcohol and hops. Nice.

33 cl bottle from Uba & Humal, Tallinn. Deep dark color with slight cappucino head. Rich nose with rich coffee and chocolate nose. Smooth velvety rich palate with loads of flavors of cofffee and spices. Surprisingly brilliant.

33 cl, bottled. 7 % (BB 09.2016). Pours black with a fine tanned head. Aroma: Coffee, roasted malt. Taste: Medium+ sweet, pleasant bitterness. Coffee, malts in flavour. Hints of salt. Minerals, minimal tones of some wood, leather -  unlit tobacco. Palate: Medium body, quite crisp carbonation, a bit oily. Strong bitter aftertaste. Interesting strong stout.
Bottle. Great coffee aroma with caramel and brandy. Taste: like espresso, only better, chocolate, cream, sparkling, delicious!
330ml bottle @ Koht. Pours black with a thin brown head. Strong coffee notes, roastedness. Flavor has espresso, ash, roasted malt. Dry finish.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malts, coffee / Malta tostada, cafe.

Pitch black oily color with a brown foam ring. The smell is best described by the name of the beer. The taste is smooth, sweet, light oily, thick and intense on coffee flavors and has the stout typical particle mouth feeling. The aftertaste is smooth, thick and coffee and chocolate like. Great beer.

Pours out looking like soda with an opaque dark maroon body and a thin tan head. Aromas are fruits and dark chocolate, flavors fairly similar. Actually drinking it adds plenty of roasted flavor. Perfect light and frothy mouthfeel. Very impressive stuff!

Bottle. Black with creamy head, looks like coffee :). In aroma great espresso coffee with some chocolate malts in the background. In taste coffee notes with nice roastiness, no sourness. Medium body, dry finish, low bitterness. Great beer.

Deep black opaque with a beautiful mocha head but so so retention. Aroma is strong espresso with some cocoa notes. Flavor is dry espresso with some very dark chocolate malts and a slight alcoholic sweetness. Medium palate, enjoyable

Almost black
With a nice fine beige head.
The smell is coffee
Taste is roasted/burnt malt and coffee
Coffee finish

Pours fairly dark, not completely black though. Aroma of dark malts, ash and coffee.

Taste is coffee and a barrage of the drier dark malt taste. Expected it to be a bit more creamy than it was.

Bottle from Bier-deluxe.

Deep black color with a frothy off-white head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, tabaco and hints of caramel. Flavor is roasted malt and chocolate, hints of coffee and smoked. Low carbonation in a full body with a dry coffee finish.

Pours almost pitch black with nice head. Aroma: beautiful aroma of fresh coffee beans and roasted malt. Taste: very well balanced bitterness and pleasant dark roasted malt body. Absolutely no coffee sourness. Fantastic stout also for the summer, when you do not necessarily need a 10% ABV Russian Imperial Stout.

33 cl. bottle at Kung Fu II Izakaya Bar, Copenhagen. Near black colour with a creamy, tanned head. Roasted aroma with caramel, chocolate, coffee, red berries, herbal hops bitterness. Espresso beans is clearly present. Taste is bitter. Full body with a creamy, velvet like texture. Soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter-roasted. Excellent Stout, good pairing with the rich, fried meat.

Pours a rich dark black color with a nice ephemeral java head. Nose is rich malt, roasted dark espresso with some chocolate notes. Taste is sweet chocolate with a rich mocha Java flavor as well. Very smooth, velvety and drinkable. Finishes on the same tasting notes, finish is dry, sweet and abrupt. Nice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

Nase: Deutliche Espresso Note, Frisches Brot. Geschmack: Röstaromen mis säurigem Abgang, leichte Note nach Verbranntem.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice dark brown color. Not as dark as some espresso stouts, but dark enough to look delicious. The head is a nice color as well. As one might expect, that aroma has a good coffee component, along with chocolate and buttery caramel. The beer is rich in the mouth with lots of coffee flavor mixed with dark chocolate. The carbonation is a bit much for this beer, but I think that will get better if the beer sits in the glass for a while. The aftertaste is not as rich as a would like, but this is a very solid beer. An odd one to find in Montana, but one of the better stouts I have had in Montana to be honest.

Bottle 0,33 @ deTolly Baar.
Dark brown. Aroma: roasted, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste: coffee, well balanced, pleasent aftertaste. Alcohol well hidden. Solid stout.

Bottle 330ml. Dark brown color with small dark brown head. Sweet and pleasant stout smell with strong roasted coffee aroma notes. Light sweet in taste, and very strong and heavy espresso coffee aftertaste.

Bottled. As the name says, the beer smells like coffee and roasted caramel. Color is dark brown, visually boozy with light brown slight foam. Taste is bitter on tongue. Mouth feel is creamy and thick, medium heavy body.

Pretty good stout although doesn't have a lot on the finish but still pleasing. The espresso masks the alcohol pretty well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours black with a thick, foamy dark brown head. It has chocolate, roasted, coffee, a whiff of fruit and vanilla. It has a creamy, but lively texture due to carbonation. There is espresso flavors, with cocoa, coffee, a bit of dark fruit, and roasted malts with a bitter pack of a finish.

330ml bottle - pours dark brown with tan head . Mild cocoa and espresso aroma . Tasted is roasted espresso beans with hints of vanilla and milk chocolate . Very nice offering . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Rich dark chocolate and roasted coffee aroma. Classic dark stout appearance with off white head. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted nuts flavour. Full bodied. Sweet malt finish. Great stout.

Bottle at Copenhagen Beer Festival. Low fluffy light brown lasting head. Pitch black body. Roasted malt coffee caramel aroma and flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness, well balanced with just the right level of alcohol. Low carbonation, long finish.

0,33 l bottle from drinks-of-the-world.de, 7.0% abv, best before 9/2015. Clear, dark brown to black with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, brown head. Intense aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and licorice with hints of plums. Pleasant taste of roasted coffee beans, dark chocolate, a bit of licorice and plums. Medium long, slightly bitter finish with lots of coffee. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not the biggest coffee fan, but the slight fruitiness makes this a very tasty beer. Still overrated in my opinion.

The beer has got a deep black colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Taste of dark chocolate, coffee beans, espresso, malt, roast and dark fruits. Roasty coffee finish. Nice one.

Wie man es halt von einem Stout mit Espresso erwartet. Etwas Milch, dazu ein wenig Holz, Weizen und ein guter Schuss Kaffee nebst Roestmalzen. Bitterkeit moderat, durchaus sueffig. Fuer ein dunkles Bier nicht schlecht.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Very dark red amber colour. Almost Black. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Chocolate and coffee notes. Heavy bitter flavor. Nice chocolate and coffee notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
