Huge beige head. Fine roasted coffee notes. Choco. Some carb. Dry. Complex. Maybe to much nespresso.

Dark almost black with mocha-colored head. Aroma slightly sweet, coffee and chocolate. Taste like aroma with fruity tones in between.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at Tuulelohe (Tallinn Airport). Pours close to pitch black with a modest, beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, roasted coffee, chocolate, dark fruits and hints of spices. Sweet, flavourful and desserty. Lovely coffee stout, well balanced and tasty. Quite delicious!
Pours black with beige head. Aroma is espresso coffee and toasted malts. Taste is big roasted malt in front and then espresso coffee comes in with bitter chocolate.
Black with creamy beige head. Roasted, fruity aroma with sweet coffee and milk chocolate. Flavour is similar with coffee slightly more pronounced. Creamy and dry mouthfeel. Nice.
Black colour, mocca head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee and brown sugar. Taste is light bitter, slightly sweet, espresso flavour. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Is very nice.
Pours black with a thin light brown foam, smell is bitter cocoa, red fruits, taste is bitter/sour, pure cocoa, roasted malts; nice black malts aftertaste, overall nice beer but not perfectly balanced

On a un liquide bien noir, avec de léger reflets grenat à la lumière, une jolie mousse crémeuse et généreuse se forme,et retombe assez vite et laisse un collier , comme un vrai espresso.Au nez, cest chocolaté , le café est là, mais assez léger je trouve par rapport a ce que jattendais.; on est quand meme clairement dans le café qui réveille plus que dans le jus de chaussette...en bouche,cest léger, je mattendais à une texture plus sirupeuse,mais non, cest léger,et sincerement café, chocolat, plus que cacao, légerement vanillé,hmmm, et revla le café, le grain de café bien senti, suave mais pas acide, larrière gout est phénoménale, vraiment celui dun espresso, cest léger et facile à boire,ça vous laisse le palais entièrement recouvert dune couche de café,et ça dure, ça dure .cest bon ,cest doux.Le réglisse apparait en se réchauffant.Cest idéalement équilibré,si je devais trouver une critique, cest un peu trop retenu, on est au bord de lImpérial, mais il manque lextravagance..
Bottle a black colored beer with a white head aroma roasted malts coffee espresso caramel spicy dark fruits and hops flavor roasted malts coffee spicy laurel caramel dark fruits and bitter hops

330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Labelled as 7%. Pours dark brown black with a dissipating off white head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Mouthfeel is a little oily. Some berries in here. Dry finish. Great stuff.

33 cl teku glass. Straight from Japan to Milan in my luggage. Pours a large espresso/very tanned creamy and dense head; pitch black colour. Smells dark chocolate, with wonderful espresso notes, vanilla, rich malts. Tastes italian moka coffee, cocoa, licorice, roasted malts, bit wood; mild sweetness and bitterness too, super smooth and so greatly balanced, nice umami too. Correct and quite soft carbonation, medium bodied, silky and slightly sticky body, bit astringency too. Such a remarkably, great clean cocoa and roasty finish, clean especially for being a stout. Balance, smoothness.. and refinement say it all, awesome and solid brew

This is a good looking stout. The body is jet black with a mocha head that looks for all money as if it is actually a thickshake. The aroma is of an espresso dessert with dark chocolate and maybe even a whiff of peat smoke. Some vanilla comes through the fug of coffee and woodsmoke. Glorious. It is thick and lush, more like mousse than beer with a creamy, sweet finish. I get the fruit toward the end - black cherry jam. 
This is love, it really is.

Appearance is very dark, ruby hints, with a foamy light brown head which leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma- loads of coffee, hint of vanilla, dark chocolate, espresso, tiramisu, fudge cake. Taste- big roastiness, masses of coffee- rich espresso, with an underlying toffee/caramel sweetness. Burnt toast, rich malts, dark chocolate cake, excellent- tastes bigger than 7%.

Je découvrais les droits marquées en café avec cette bière japonaise. Même si je reconnais la profondeur de texture, la richesse de gout, je nai pas non plus été co quais. Mais il y a un vrai travail , doù une note correcte.

Bottle at SBWF 2012.
Pale brown head. Red-brown color. Roasted malty aroma that also dominate the taste together with chocolate and soy taste.

Bottled in Haggis Pub Moscow. Deep black colour, intensive aroma of green coffee. Taste is verry dry same coffee as it is in aroma, bitterness is strong enough. Later you can feel pleasant smoothness and light cream notes. Good balance even im not a big fan of coffee RIS style.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
chocolate, coffee, roasty, cereal, herbs, black, hazy, frothy, brown foam, light sweetness, very bitter, salty, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

This is a very easy going stout. Clean espresso, and big smacks of hop. It leaves you wanting more, but more of what? I'm not sure. I could easily transfer to espresso martinis at this point, or head back to a dry lip-smacking porter. Its a fantastic beer and definitely worth seeking out. Well done.
Cocoa-y, caramel, vanilla, espresso. Very full feel. One of my favorite stouts.
Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 07/03/2015.Color negro, espuma beige. Aromas a chocolate. Cuerpo ligero. Carbonatacion moderada.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours an opaque black / brown, decent head that dies to a ring, small flecks of lace. Nose is light roasted malt, some minor coffee notes. Tastes sweet, chocolate, bitter, roasted malt, coffee beans and like coffee grounds at times, I like it though. One of the more smooth espresso stouts Ive had.

pretty good version of a coffee stout. I actually get a strong currant flavor which isnt bad but I prefer more of a bitter roasted flavor especially sine this has espresso beans added. Huge down tick for me is almost $6 for a 330ml bottle! That is insane! Wont buy again due to price but a very well made stout.

Nachtschwarze Farbe mit bräunlichem Schaum.mGeruch nach Kaffee, Karamell und Alkohol. Eher trocken, wenig Schokolade. Geschmack relativ bitter und trocken. Eindeutiges Kaffeearoma, wenig Schokolade, keine Raucharomen.
Geruch leicht säuerlich mit Kaffeenoten. Im Geschmack kommt dann der Espresso klar durch, der wie ein Espresso auch nachhängt.
Aroma: malt, coffee, roasty, Appearance: black, hazy, brown foam, Taste: medium sweetness, very bitter, Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

This beer pours a dark black color with a thick khaki head that had good retention and left great lacing around the glass. The aroma is espresso, dark coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, some ash. The flavor is dark roasted barley, dark roasted bitter coffee, charcoal, dark fruits, and some chocolate. I dont pick up much hops and the mouthfeel is medium. For the price, this beer is not an every day drinker but it is worth at least one try.

Great beer! Thick dense caramel-coloured head, nearly black. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, dried plum. In the mouth also coffee, dried plum. very good balance of bitterness and sweetness. Creamy texture, medium carbonation.

Bottled. Aroma dark roasted malts, pretty intense. Very dark colour. Taste is strongly coffeeish. Rather coffee dregs than fresh espresso, but nicely fruity nevertheless and full of dark roasted flavours. Very good.
Bottle. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Coffee, ash, licorice, alcohol. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, wood, ash, hops. Enjoyable beer.

330ml bottle bb07/2015, courtesy of Calisky, merci. Nice black, medium-thick pour with beige head. Still contained aromas, even upon warming, of Hasseltse koffie, aka strong filter coffee with a dash of jenever. Bit of a sleek aluminium character to it as well. Really shines in taste, with very potent arabica berries, precise roast, more strong filter coffee rather than espresso, thinly strewn out bitter chocolate merging with exotic stone fruit hops in the back. Great dry finish recalling pulverised version of all those tastes. Should be very impressed if the label is to be believed that this is a Reinheitsgebot brew.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2015 Re-rate: Bottle from Hasegawa. Big dark cacao notes on the nose with lots of coffee and a slight hint of vanilla. Taste is cacao and coffee with a bitter roasted coffee edge. Dark bitter chocolate and french roasted coffee finish. Valentines label version 330ml bottle from Liquors Hasegawa in Tokyo. Poured into a English tulip pint. Black with a caramel hue and huge brown sugar colored head that dissipates fairly quickly. Cacao and malt aroma is big and in-your-face. Hints of coffee and milk chocolate present as well. Taste is big, bold and chocolatey with nice dark roasted coffee swirled in on the palate. Reminds me of a cafe mocha. As it comes to room temperature the flavors persist and a little dark fruit sneaks out as well: currant, fig and plum. Gorgeous beer.

bottle. clear dark brown almost black color with strong caramel color head. smells roast malts and coffee. taste are fine mix between roast malt - bitter - and coffee. aftertaste are fine firs u taste roast malt and bitter after few seconds u taste dark chocolate with espresso coffee with fine medium dry finish.

Bottle. Thick oily black appearance with a small layer of head that quckly disappears. Aroma is coffe, vanilla, chocolate, and anise. Taste is light roast, followed by coffee and a hint of vanilla, finshes with more coffee roast and some subtle sweetness. Medium bodied, high carb. Tasty stuff, lots of coffee roast, and very well balanced.

Bottle -black with a brown bubbling head. Aroma of coffee grounds, earth, soil, lots of roasty malts and a hint of vanilla. Taste of vanilla, cocoa beans, roasted coffee and a light bitterness to finish. Medium body, high carbonation.
bottle. black with thick brown head. aroma of coffee and caramel. full bodied, creamy, medium bitter with lots of coffee.
33 cl. bottle. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of coffee, roasted malt, dried fruit and chocolate.
Pours black. Aroma and taste are coffee, roasted malts, and some chocolate hints.

Bottle from Beermoth.

Pours dark brown, with red-tan head, which goes away quickly. Aroma of Coffee, Chocolate, roasted malts. Taste of initial Coffee, quite faint, then dark fruits and chocolate, then another stage of Coffee, then vanilla, then another blast of Coffee. Not enough Coffee flavours.....Loved it!

Bottle from LCBO.
Very dark with brown head. Lovely aroma of dark chocolate and coffee and raspberry and hazelnut. Nice mouthfeel. Dark chocolate and espresso flavours.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate and coffee, taste is chocolate, coffee, fruity.

Bottle to glass. Pours black, little head. Aroma is black coffee, dark chocolate, a bit of complex fruitiness. Roast malt lingers on the nose. Taste is fantastic. Nice complex coffee / espresso up front, smooths out to dark chocolate and faint cherries / pomegranate. Mmm! Thick body, medium carbonation. Really impressed. Lots of flavor and complexity.
Thick full bodied coffee stout. Pitch black pour creamy mocca head. Coffee aroma and taste slighly sweet not too bitter coffee.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Huge stout! Moderate roasted malts, loads of coffee, dark choco, light vanilla, dried dark fruits. Oily smootish, full bodied. Moderate sweet with light bitterness.
 Another great coffee stout for breakfast. Highly enjoyable

Not a big stout fan thus the low rating. Though tastes as advertised but too much taste of coffee etc. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown / black beer with a small beige head, low carbonation.
Tastes like espresso coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, cocao and chocolate.
Cofee bitter aftertaste, nice stout.

June 28th, 2013 - Hitachino has been fighting against the current in Japans pale lager soaked market for quite a few years now. The beer scene is changing, in Tokyo and elsewhere, but as it does so I believe Hitachino deserves regularly accolades for paving the way and holding fast when Japanese brewing legislation made it difficult to brew something with a little flavor invested in the recipe. This dark, rich looking bear guards itself from the atmosphere with a large, inch thick dome of bubbles, which release a perfume that is potent and rich with a dairy creaminess and low, shy chocolate darkness. The flavor abounds with espresso flavor, though its not at all bitter - unlike the real deal, which I still delightedly pucker through. The sparks of flavor resembling dark chocolate cacao nibs are good, too, creating an overall deep, dark beer that would be well served alongside select kinds of Japanese cuisine: anything barbecued or sauced, or any meal accompanied by a lovely Japanese snowfall.
355ml bottle, pours black with a tan head. Aroma is rich coffee, roasted malt, light caramel, body is medium, texture is oily and slick, soft carbonation. Finish is coffee and light bitter.

Bottle 330ml. Pours dark brown with small brownish head. Aroma is roasted malt and coffee. Taste is a little bitter and a bit sour (it has travelled a long way), coffee, also with hints of fruit. A little bit of chocolate coming through at the the end. Was expecting more coffee from this beer. An ok stout, would have liked more body.

Bottle. Black colour with medium dark brown head.
Chocolate, mildly roasted malt, coffee and hint of dark fruits on aroma.
Taste is coffee, espresso, chocolate and vanilla.
Medium bodied with very soft carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel.
Soft finish with vanilla, chocolate and coffee.
I was somehow expecting bit more "in your face" espresso character. Would love to try imperial version of this.
Smooth beer with lots of Coffee, not much chocolate though. Quality without being spectacular.

Bottle shared with Mixos thanks to Rouhlas ! Pours dark almost black with a thick beige head. Aroma is a coffee heaven, some roasted dark malts and roasted caramel. Taste is really Good ,full of espresso coffee and roasted malts.Good body soft carbonation and cofee bitter aftertaste! Ive enjoyed it so much. Good stuff !!!
from Erzbierschof - black beer with a solid roasted coffeish aroma; full-bodied and tasty; dry bitter, earthy and long coffeish aftertaste - one-dimensional yet very good

Black color, big brown creamy head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, dark berries, licorice. Dry taste with gently bitter finish and roasty aftertaste with notes of coffee. Medium body and average carbonation. Nice stout.

Very dark brown color, almost completely black, average brownish head. Aroma of coffee, dark fruits, roasted malt, some green herbs (it reminded me of wasabi). Taste is the same. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Excellent stuff.

Aroma: intense coffee, very sweet, chocolate. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: light sweet and bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, cacao, dark chocolate, toasted malts, coffee, soft carbonation, quite a dry finish. Overall: nice Stout, great coffee aroma, nice palate. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.
Bottle @ vlc on tap valencia. Black colour with creamy beige head. Coffee aroma, heavy strong sweet flavour, strong bitterness coffee, very long roasted coffee aftertaste

Completely dark, huge tan head which drops to medium sized one. Divine aroma, I could smell it all day long, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa and roasted malt. Taste is same plus spices. Too bad its thin. Overall very good.(Bier Deluxe 0,33l bottle)
on tap at the brewpub; clear gold color; nice, spicy aroma; a nice spicy, light bodied beer with peppery spice notes; well balanced

330 mL bottle. Pours black with a thin cap of khaki. Nice aromas of raisins, dark caramel, demerara, smooth espresso, deep woods and a touch of charred malt. Pleasently multidimensional. Lightly sweet with a bitter roasty finish. Moderate plus body and light carbonation. Lingers. Very good.

Brune foncée presque noire, reflets rouges, demi doigt de mousse chocolat crémeuse. Nez de chocolat, café, bonbon au caramell. Bouche maère, café, chocolat, raisin, suir, vin, légère acidité. Très bonne longueur en bouche, légère astringence.

Bottle: Literally black, mid-sized craemy and stable tanned head; moderate sweetish nose of coffee, toasted malt and dried black berries; medium to bodie, very soft; moderate to solid sweet and bitter flavour; lingering - maybe a bit drier - coffeeish and toasty finish. A very fine Sake

Pours pitch black with a limited tan ring no lacing. Nose is espreso and some fruit. Flavours are dark fruit, some tangy berries, some espresso, some chocolate. Taste med bitter med sweet. Medium somewhat creamy body with light carbonation.

330 ml bottle from BierDeluxe, Germany. Black cοlor with a nice thin light brown head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate and maybe some ground. Taste is bitter at start with roasted and coffee, and finishes sweet with chocolate and maybe some plums. Medium body with low to medium carbonation.

Bottle from Euston Tap. Aroma holds espresso coffee, vanilla and some roasted malts. Pours black with a medium beige head. Taste is a nice sweet tasteful mix of chocolate and coffee. Palate is thick though drinkable. Overall nice beer, though I wished for a bigger taste.

Amazing beer. Brown head black beer small carbination slow. Smell nothing off coffee just caramel chocolate maybe and bitterness maybe and can tell smell wise its a dark beer. Starts off bitter and a little boozy and then bam flavor opens up and its roastedness caramel and coffee and sites nice for a while on tounge. Amazing beer. Cheers!!!!

First Stout I drink from Japan. Rich, thick, dark chocolate. Mazinger and Godzilla approved!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark and clear with a light fine head. Aggressive aroma of burnt, roasted coffee. Some pepper. Flavor is predominantly coffee with roasted barley notes. Very smooth, creamy mouthfeel.

Dark-chocolate brown, rich light-brown fine head, fades moderately quickly to textured film and ring. Aroma is a burnt two-day-old coffee, with hint of chocolate and raw sugar cane, touch of soy sauce, some toffee. Creamy mouthfeel, very fine carbonation, velvet. Flavor is a chocolate-mocha punch, bit of green tea, slightly hot on the exhale, balanced and nicely infuse flavors. Highlight is the creamy body and mochachino.

Not a bad stout at all. Better in bottle, somewhat bitter if poured hard to make head. Head not worth the pour. That said, not too impressed off the bat but while eating food it went down smooth and easy, was swigging it as if it were a bud light, though I enjoyed my ice water more.
Bottle at home, 27th December 14. Dark pour, large head. Aroma dark roasted coffee beans, a little chocolate. Taste is smooth, high quality coffee , and a dusting of cocoa. Lovely stout

Bottle; pours very dark brown with a mocha colored head; roasted coffee aroma with hints chocolate and dark fruit; taste is bittersweet roasted coffee with some chocolate, vanilla, and dark fruit; bitter coffee finish; very drinkable and nicely balanced hiding the alcohol

12-16 oz on draft at True Brew Mito Station, plastic cup with the free beer ticket from the Kiuchi tour. Finished it off on the train ride to Ueno Station. Black with tan head. Aromas of roast, coffee, dark chocolate. Tastes of coffee/espresso, bitter roast, dark chocolate, caramel. Medium-full body with a dry finish.
330ml LCBO bottle. black, tan head. huge deep black malt aroma. dark fruit, touch of soy, toffee. the depth is impressive, but it remains highly drinkable. love this beer and this brewery.

Incredible amount of strong dark coffee with sweet cocoa powder, and light grassy hops. Regular mouth feel, and carb. The finish is super roasty, with another incredible amount of cold coffee with a hint of cocoa sweetness. A superb stout.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep brown-black with a creamy tan head.
 
Aroma: Rich, roasted, sweet malts, milk chocolate and vanilla, coconut(?), with an odd fruity/savoury note
 
Palate: Fairly full, silky body and full, rounded, velvety carbonation, really nice mouthfeel.
 
Flav.: Milk chocolate, cacao, some coffee notes, coconut, rich and friendly, still has an off, savoury tropical fruit thing going on, roasted malts and a bit of grape jelly; sweet with fair bitterness and a long, smooth, coffee and milk chocolate finish.

Quite a good sipper.
330ml bottle. Murky dark brown with a ring of tan foam. Flavors are milk chocolate, vanilla, coffee, roasted malts and caramel with fruity notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

(Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout) Bottle 330 ml from a trade with torriman, thanks! Served into a snifter, ABV 7%
Pours a totally black beer, with a tall, thick and creamy dark brown head. Excellent retention. Heavy lacing left around the glass.
Aroma has lots of coffee, roasted malts, light vanilla, light liquorice.
Taste has also lots of roasted malts and coffee, light acidity like olive pit, sugars, vanilla, some berries even. Light bitterness. 
Medium to full body, carbonation on the right levels. Sticky on the palate while smooth and creamy.
Great beer, what a nice surprise! Like an Imperial Stout minus the alcoholic strength, excellent.

Yet another great Hitachino beer. Pours a slightly muddy brown with a tan head. Smells of espresso, vanilla and the classic Hitachino red bean. Taste is similar, starts sweet and full bodied, with some espresso in the finish. Had in the bottle at The Pig and the Pickle.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2014 330ml bottle. Pours very fizzy, thin head, dark black. Aroma is bitter, black chocolate. Taste is strong coffe with dark chocolate coming through later. Very nice as a one off, couldn?t drink more than a couple in one sitting

330 ml bottle. Pours black with a resilient, creamy beige head. Aroma is coffee and roast. Flavor is coffee, roast, dark chocolate, burnt caramel, ash, roasted hazelnut. Finish is very bitter, coffee, dark chocolate and dairy cream. Lingering bitterness and notes of lactic acid. Medium body, soft, velvety mouthfeel, average carbonation. Excellent!
roasty, coffee, earthy, soy sauce, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, umami, salty, full body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter,

Bottle at DaDa Sheffield - Jet black body, healthy beige head. Nose is a heavy heady coffee, lots of toasted nuts and malts. The taste has loads of black coffee in it, loads of bitter beans too. Exquisite.

330ml bottle. Pours black with a half finger, khaki head that thins to a bubbly ring. Aroma has smooth notes of dark and milk chocolate, fine roasted malts, mild coffee, caramel, dark fruits,  and a hint of alcohol. Taste is bitter. Dark chocolate and chocolate milk to start, then firm roasted malts, and an espresso bitter aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a very dry finish. Overall a great coffee beer. Dark chocolate and roasty malts with a dry, espresso bitter finish.
caramel, roasty, woody, black, cloudy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, creamy, average carbonation,

2014/11/23-Pours a jet black colour with a frothy tan head that slowly reduces and leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, caramel, cocoa and vanilla. Taste is roasted coffee, bitter cocoa, vanilla and moderately sweet caramel. Mouthfeel is a little thinner than expected, with smooth carbonation and a bitter, drying finish. Pretty good, but I would have preferred it to be a little thicker.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from LCBO. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, molasses. Big coffee flavour with chocolatey sweetness and a bitter finish. Nice coffee stout.

Tarry dark brown with toffee brown foamy head. Smells of some nice hops with sweet black fruit and coffee. Taste is round with sweet dark fruit and chocolate and coffee. Some spicy herbal undertones. I really like this, the basic flavor is sweet rather than malt-roasty and the roast of the espresso comes through in compliment.

Looks almost black; dark cream-coloured foam, fine and non persistent. Smell of sake, caramel, soya sauce, liquorice, and obviously coffee. Beautifully done, tremendous with the chocolate-ginger mousse I tasted with. Definitively perfect with chocolate.

330ml bottle from the LCBO
chocolate, coffee, roasty, herbs, smoke, 
black, cloudy, frothy, 
full body, oily feel, average carbonation, 
very good after a cold day shoveling snow

Pitch black colour with a brown head. I find the aroma very brine like or marsh like. there is that espresso grounds and chocolatel but mostly it stands out for having a certain vegemite or low land quality. I find the palate big enough, though not huge, filled withsome espresso and classic stout roast with a hint of fruit. I think the aroma on this one is more interesting than any other aspect. glad i tried it though!

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours black with mocha head. Nose is sweet chocolatey coffee, which dominates the taste. This is the beer version of a dark chocolate covered espresso bean. Tastes better as it warms and more and more carbonation is released. Really good.

330ml bottle 
7.0% ABV (as written on bottle)
Royal Bank Plaza LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
The beer pours a solid black colour with a generous light brown creamy head which lasts, The aroma is roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with average carbonation. The flavour is quite sweet, milk chocolate, coffee, with a bitter finish.
Tons of espresso on the nose and in the mouth...just everywhere. Espresso, dark chocolate and dark fruit.

Smells great, espresso, dark chocolate, soy sauce aromas. Completely black, thick brown head. Beautiful. Tastes quite nice, espresso integrates quite well. Upfront sweet espresso coffee, dark chocolate metallic notes, finishes leafy hoppy and molasses. Average carbonation and medium bodied. Coffee doesnt overpower here, which is great by me. Body could be a little bit thicker and could be slightly more balanced, but a very good espresso stout.
330 ml. bottle. Pour almost black with a decent khaki head. Aroma of coffee, malt, and chocolate. Taste is coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, and a bit of vanilla. Very good.

19/X/14 - 33cl bottle @ Beuks postponed Firestone Walker and other nice beers allowed as well tasting (Brussels) - BB: IX/2015 (2014-1228) Thanks to ElManana for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of coffee, roasted, caramel, sweet, some vanilla, charcoal. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of coffee, bitter, roasted, fruity touch, some forest fruit candy, dried fruits. Aftertaste: coffee, cocoa powder, banana touch, caramel, bit sweet, dried fruits.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an amber-tinged dark brown with small beige head. Aroma lives up to the name - lots of roast and espresso with hints of fruit and cocoa. Flavour is also very roasty and big on espresso character; notes of anise, cocoa and dark fruit. Rich, slick mouthfeel. Quite good.

330ml bottle - 

What a way to start out 2013!!! What an amazing stout, full of complexity and showcasing a knowledge of brewing greatness. Deep espresso aroma, scorched dark chocolate, black licorice, and a kiss of alcohol. Opaque black body, a 4-finger thick creamy head, coating the glass...thick...murky...ominous...perfect. The flavor of this this beauty keeps giving and giving. Waves of rich mocha, fresh cream, a bit of soy/meat marinade, a touch smoky, a bit of buttery toffee...amazing. The balance of coffee/chocolate is stunning. What a great beer.
Pours black with white head. Aroma is roast, caramel, coffee. Taste is espresso, coffee, chocolate. Good stuff.

(35 cl bottle from Toft Vin poured into Rochefort goblet; BBD: June 2015) Pours black with one finger toffee head. Decent retention and nice lace. Aroma is subdued caramel and roasted malt with notes of dark fruit and a hint of coffee. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium to full body and a lingering slightly sweet finish. Flavour is softly sweet with notes of vanilla. Remniscient of Samuel Smiths Imperial Stout.

Dark body and thin head. Odd lacing. Interesting mouthfeel, oily yet not thick. Toast and roast aromas, umami, some black coffee. Its odd but interesting. (33cl bottle shared with Alex, from Saveur Bière)
Schwarz, beiger Schaum. In der Nase Kaffee, Espresso, Bitterschokolade, Milch, Vanille, brauner Zucker. Am Gaumen Bitterschokolade, Kakao, Kaffee. Cremig, vollmundig, gut.
Pours a deep brown with mocha head. Aroma is lots of coffee,caramel,malt. Taste is alot of coffee,like drinking a cold one actually,very nice and refreshing.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2014.
Appearance: Black colour with almost no head.
Aroma: Coffee, spices, roasted malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, malt, roasted malt, some more coffee.

It pours black with a 2 finger head of tannish foam.

I get roasted malt, milk chocolate, and some coffee.

Very roasty to my palate, coffee grounds are strongish, dark chocolate bitterness, hops bring a hint of fruit. Nice.

Nice body and mouth feel.

This is very good and not over the top with the abv. Geez, look at that lacing!

this was like a stout version of coffee bender. coffee with a side of beer. delicious and aromatic, not alot of complexity our stoutishness, if you will. it did mask the 7.5% almost completely, and the coffee/roasted malt aspect was quite nice, so i will score it fairly high myself, but it wasnt a 99th percentile beer for me. "
bottle shared with josh at club, w, pitch black pour with brown head, strong coffe and chocolate taste, perfect , will do again

Bottle, 7.0% ABV. Dark brown body, tall tan head. Aroma has espresso roast but its not very fresh anymore. The "best before" date says its good to drink until 2015.04 but the coffee is already losing the freshness. Taste has roasty espresso but again, its not fresh. Some stale beans in the finish. Im sure this beer (like all coffee beers) will be better when its fresh.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and a little vanilla. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 240914

Bottle, 7%. Very dark brown with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel and espresso. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, chocolate, espresso, medium sweet, hop, little liquorice and medium bitter.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, espresso, dark chocolate. Flavor is malt, bitter dark chocolate, espresso, some dark fruit. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry light bitter finish. 240914
Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Dark brown color with thick brown head. Aroma malts and coffee. Taste bitter, burnt bread, dark chocolate. Medium body.

Poursdark brown with medium brownish head.
Aroma of roasted malts, coffee.Taste is roasted malts, coffee, medium bitter, dark chocolate. Soft carbonation.Well balanced. Full body. Good one

355 ml bottle at Põrgu in Tallinn ( 5,70). BB 4/2015. Pours a black colour with a ring of dark brown around the edge. Dark, creamy head drops slowly, leaves a thin film and some lacing, then vanishes. Nose is a very deep mix of dark chocolate, cocoa and well-roasted coffee. The roastiness recalls black bread crust. Mild acidity and maybe even some wild berries. Taste begins with a milky sweet chocolate, then a more dark bitter chocolate, whereas in the finish its got a good hoppy bitterness. Palate dry and roasty bitter with a small but prickly carbonation. Alcohol hidden. Overall a very nice, sweet and chocolaty - maybe even overly so - Stout. Kind of expected more of a coffee kick (my palate mightve had been ruined by garlic bread).

Bottled. Pours black with a large, creamy, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, cofee and chocolate notes. Sweet flavor that endes up dry with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Impy.
This truly more like coffee than beer starting from appearance to aroma and finishing with the aftertaste. If you like coffee (which I dont) then this is the sure choice for you.

(bottle, 35.5cl) Black coloured hue with a big and brown firm foamy head. Roasty and slightly leafy malty aroma notes of coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate and a whiff of marzipan. Roasty bitter flavor with a tinge of acidity, which I appreciate in Stouts, medium bodied with a soft, almost creamy carbonation. Robust roasted malt character with distinctive espresso/coffee flavours, accompanied by notes of dark chocolate and traces of liquorice sweetness; roasty bitter finish with coffee flavours, liquorice and a subtle note of cassis in the aftertaste. Very solid brew. 07.IX.14

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2015 2014: 33cl draught at Smith Street Taps, Singapore. Dark, almost black with a small head. Coffee and malt aroma. Little carbonation, medium body . Taste of roasted malt, strong coffee and dark chocolate. A nice beer to accompany dessert (if you like coffee!). 3.3.  11/07/15 - 33cl bottle. Creamy chocolate malt with a spicy warmth and the bitterness of coffee.  A little lactose sweetness as it warms in the glass. Pretty good. Reared from 3.3 to 3.5.

This was poured into a pint glass. 
The appearance was a nice dark brown close to black color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute. There was some light lacing sticking and then sliding down into the beer. 
The smell had a wonderful thick espresso - like aroma embracing a light cocoa in the background. Light dark fruits invite me to smell even more. 
The taste was a great blend of sweet dark fruits to espresso to cocoa - really nice. 
On the palate, this one sat right about a medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. It seemed like it was properly carbonated. Theres a long lingering dark fruity aftertaste. 
Overall, pretty good stuff Id have again.

Bottle from Four Firkins. Pours darker-than-cola with a tan head. Somewhat lowly carbonated. Aroma has huge espresso notes, with caramel and chocolate, but tons of roast and some lactose-y presence. Taste is of rich roasty bitter espresso, milk chocolate, some nuts, some caramelly malts, an undercurrent of dark fruits and a mellowing milky-ness. Medium to full bodied with little alcohol presence. Finishes nicely blended between bitter (espresso/chocolate) and sweet (caramel/lactose). Very nice, very tasty, but something does not carry through all the way. A good one that could have been great. 15.1

Bue en bouteille de 33cl, couleur noire, petite mousse brune et effervescence moyenne, une bière avec, et cest normal, une énorme attaque sur le café, mais ce qui me dérange, cest lamertume qui en reste une amertume du café mais du café froid réchauffé le lendemain après quil soit resté dans un percolateur toute la nuit. Je crois donc que ce nest absolument pas mon style de bière.

How ironic that in the two months I spent in Japan, I sought but never found the Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout. I found many of their other beers, but not this one.

I found it tonight at Total Wine & More in Goodyear, AZ.

From the bottle, pours black with hints of ruby around the edges. Almost no head and no lacing. Aroma is light coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. Taste is the same, very slightly sweet, with a gentle hoppy bitterness. Mouthfeel is a little thin for a stout. Slightly bitter finish. Like many stouts, taste improves as it warms.

Bottle @ home from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep black liquid with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: high malty nose with coffee and chocolate notes, licorice and sugar cane. Great complexity of sugar. Nice beer!!! Taste: the complexity is also on mouth good body on mouth with caramel and roasted malt taste. Notes of chocolate and coffee. The beer is not so viscous on mouth, really easy on mouth. About the flavor maybe hard for a beginner or a stout-unfan. Aftertaste: nice caramel and sugar cane taste with roasted malt. Coffee notes! Really amazing beer, I recommend it! A must to try.

Super foamy, but we didnt have a proper bottle opener. The head was light cream, it looked just like an espresso in my tea cup. Roasted bean nose, deep coffee flavor...light and airy mouth feel. Sweet with a short finish.

0,33 l / 33 cl / 330 ml, flaske, 7,0 % ABV, købt i SmagFørst på Nørre Farimagsgade i CPH City, 13. august 2914.
Sort, diset japansk Stout med moccafarvet skumkrone på 4-5 cm tykkelse. Toppen svinder til et par cm efter nogle minutter. 
Aroma af espressokaffe, lidt kælder, lidt læder og røg, men ikke specielt kraftig og karakteristisk udover kaffenoterne. Måske lidt fjern mørk chokolade. 
Smag byder til gengæld på "rigtig" kaffestout. Let sur, middel bitterhed og let til middel sødme. God fyldig krop og en god lidt sticky konsistens. Smagen sidder fint i mundvigene, selvom øllet afrundes lidt pludseligt. Veltilpasset kuldioxid uden at øllet føles flat. 
Dette er umiddelbart den næstbedste kaffestout, jeg har smagt. Kun overgået af de Molen's Mout Und Mocca.
Bottle. Almost black, beige small head. Coffee and dark chocolate. Bitter enough. Drinkable. Good.

Bouteille. L'île du malt. Robe noire, mousse beige foncé crémeuse et abondante . Nez grillé de malt, de café et de chocolat amer avec une pointe fruitée et acide de figue fraîche. En bouche on retrouve ce mélange torréfié et végétal. Attaque douce et malté, puissante de chocolat noir équilibrée de notes d'amande fraîche et de humus. Longue finale sèche et amère très expressive sur le grain de café. Belle réussite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Riktigt bra Japanare. Go smak, snygg färg och till ett hyfsat pris. Perfekt till skaldjur

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Very dark brown- almost black, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, some roasted - light burnt malt and light coffee with faint chocolate. Body is medium to full, malty and lightly sweetish, some roasted malt and light coffee chocolate with light hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dryish, some roasted - light burnt malt, light coffee and faint chocolate, light hoppyness. Nice roasted/lightly burnt and dryish stout. Not too much coffee.

330ml bottle from Bier-Deluxe


Black stuff with a big brown foam. Aroma is very roasty and coffee like. Flavour of coffee, cocoa, roastiness. I like!
logging this in from untappd to synchronize all my beers into rate beer for better statistics.

How : tap
 Where : fleurs du malt le bar, Lyon, France
 Appearance : dark with Brown head
 Aroma : dark chocolate , cofee, roasted malt
 Body : medium body
 Flavour : dark chocolate, cofee, licorice, bitter

duft: frisk mærkt mal. mørk chokolade. lidt ege.
smag: ristet malt kaffe. bitter mørk malt. lidt citrus bid

Aroma: Strong coffee scents, with roasted grain. Overall pleasing with slight dark chocolate notes
Appearance: Pours an espresso black colour, with a tanned creamy head which holds reasonably well
Taste: Leading coffee/espresso notes, followed by roasted malts, dark chocolate, and a slightly dry and subtle bitter finish
Palate: Above. Well balanced. Bitter beginning, dry finish.
Overall: A quality stout. If you enjoy your coffee, you will enjoy this even more than usual.

Aroma is deep rich roasty malts, caramel, licorice and salty oyster. Taste is roasty and slightly bitter malts and light dryness. Some espresso beans are prevelent here. Appearance is black with a medium beige head that retains fairly well.
Bottle 33 cl from Barleywine, CPH. Black with a thin brown head. Cappuccino, chocolate, cream, nice bitterness, really nice roasted malt, licorice. Full/medium body, low carbonation, bitter finish.

Sweet coffee aroma, capuchinolike, sweetend milk or cream, some chocolate. Pitch black beige head. Roasted taste with liquorice and coffe bitterness is coffelike with some dark chocolate. Light body, smooth texture. Maybe a bit light on the body, but that make it good for summer, lots of roasty goodiness.

Espresso, lots of coffe, dark chocolate and berries on the nose, rather dry. Transluscent black colour, medium Brown head, lacing. Big bite, salty, dry, not that sweet, soft and refined.
Medium body, soft carbonation, roasty finish.
Ok.

0,33L bottle, BB 04.2015, ABV 7%. Pours black with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is intense coffee, dark chocolate hints, and roast. Taste is coffee, roast, malt, dark chocolate, and some sweetness. Finish is coffee bitter with some sweetness. Overall: great brew. If you like coffee, youll love this one.

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with low head. Nose is intense on dark chocolate. Aroma is again intense on dark chocolate, dark coffee, creamy and smooth, lot of dark malt, medium sweet, clean. finish Long bitter dark chocolate on aftertaste, coffee notes, very nice.

A black beer with a big, creamy and light brown head. The aroma has storng roastiness, espresso and balanced sweetness of berries/strawberries. Taste has lots of black coffee, dry roastiness, hops together with coffee are drying the mouth. Medium+ bodied, low carbonation, nicely smooth to drink. Simple elements but the overall impression is very good. Balanced coffee.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2014 Couleur noire, forte mousse beige très cremeuse. Super nez puissant de grain de café, expresso. Gout super doux et crémeux en bouche de café malté, bien rond et intense. Fin très longue et puissante en bouche de café expresso, bien savoureuse. On ouvre la bouteille, on sarrete dun coup de tout faire, on sent on savoure longtemps,.. a deguster.... Une bombe!

Room temp bottle 7% BB Feb 2015, into snifter. Black, big foamy light brown head lasts a few minutes. Aroma - espresso, green pepper, burnt sugar, some sharp alcoholic notes. Body is very good - medium to full, pretty smooth, slightly foamy, touch of carbonation. Taste is sweetened iced coffee, soft malts, raw cocoa powder, some tangy and drying floral hoppiness. Pretty smooth and drinkable all round. Good stuff.

Nice dark appearance with a slight coffee aroma. I'm not a huge fan of coffee beers but this one has a nice dry start with a slightly sweet/coffee finish. Pleasently surprised 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Botella de 33 cl en cimmeria en el momento el 07-06-2914. Fecha de cons pref para 02-2015. Color negro intenso brillante con bastante espuma al servir, quedándose al poco tiempo en una pequeña corona de color beige oscuro. Aromas de café quemado y achicoria bastante intensos. Cuerpo medio de 7 vol con bastante espuma al paso por boca, que va desapareciendo poco a poco hasta quedarse casi en un suave licor de café torrefacto. Sabores ligeros, predominando el café y achicoria, algo de maltas tostadas y cacao. Buena increíble su sabor de café tostado y potente. Para repetir de nuevo,, claro.

7% AVB on bottle,,, where is the missing .5%...... ????? caramel, bread, chocolate, coffee, nuts, roasty, resin, dough, earthy, leather, alcohol, vanilla, raisin, licorice, black, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, fizzy, long finish,
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Bottle. Black, clear, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Bottle from Hop Hideout in Sheffield. Pours black with a tan head. Wow. This is very tasty. Start off a with a little sweetness with notes of coffee, chocolate and liquorice. The finish is dry and full of delicious coffee flavour. Very, very good. Just a tiny bit over carbonated would be my only criticism.

A great beer from the bottle or on tap. 
Strong, roasty coffee aroma with background vanilla, raisins. Rich brown colour with tan head. The taste is where it becomes exceptional. Freshly brewed coffee, chocolate, nuts, vanilla. Great bitter/sweet balance. Gorgeous mouthfeel, smooth, full bodied, creamy. Soft carbonation. Long finish.

Pours black with a fine tan head. Nose is coffee, raisin, vanilla. Flavor is obviously coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit, with a slightly burnt toast finish. The mouthfeel is really incredible, with very fine carbonation and silky, velvety, slightly thick mouthfeel. Amazing.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo.6-05-2014.
In short: a bitter viscous stout.
Pours balck with frothy roch tan head. Moderate head retention, poor lacing. Roasty, coffe, liquor, raisins, plums aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is rich, smooth, bitter, coffe, roasty, some ripe fruit notes. Smooth and balanced, very enjoyable.

On tap at world of beer in key west fl. Beautiful pearly black pour with a thin aromatic head smelling of dark coffee and hints of chocolate. Smooth on the palate with a nice aftertaste of fresh espresso. Very smooth and delectible overall
Aromas of strong coffee and dark chocolate are amazing. I love this beer. The 7% ABV never kicks in for some reason which is a slight disappointment.
Amazing beer! I could have this for breakfast instead of my triple shot flat white! Lovely dark head and massive amounts of coffee flavour with a great bitterness.

Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Clear, dark, reddy brown. Thin, tan head. Dark, malty, fruitiness. Liquorice. Light cocoa. Hint of coffee. Taste is fruity dry. Palate is more of that. Not as full bodied as I expected. Dry, light bitter finish, with more of the liquorice.
Pours black like oil, same viscosity, tan head. Espresso bean, chocolate and malt on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes sweet.

Bottle. Near black with a beige head. Aromas are rich, fruity coffee with dark chocolate. Earthy with background caramel and spicy alcohol. Flavours are roast coffee with gritty cocoa and hints of vanilla. Spritzy yeast with blackberries and vinous notes. Good dark chocolate bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle to stout glass. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, some sweetness. This pours a dark brown with a nice beige head. Taste is mostly coffee with some roastiness behind it. A bit of a sweet chocolate there as well. Overall a really dope beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle provided by teddybeer. Thx a lot. This has been on my want list for years. It pours opaque black with a creamy beige head. The aroma sweet roasted coffee notes with caramel and chocolate. The flavor is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and light tar. Smooth body. Great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
There are many better coffee stout beers available, This really is top heavy on the coffee notes, really over the top. Nice carbonation, nice mouthfeel. But it is unbalanced and bit sour.

330 ml bottle into snifter, bottled in 4/2013. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big roasted coffee bean, dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, dark bread, light char, caramel, light molasses, herbal, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and coffee notes; with great strength. Taste of roasted coffee bean, dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, dark bread, light char, caramel, light molasses, herbal, and roasted earthiness. Fair amount of roasted coffee bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of coffee, chocolate, cocoa, roast, toast, dark bread, caramel, light molasses, herbal, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, balance, and robustness of dark/roasted malt and coffee flavors; with a great roasted sweetness/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a creamy, smooth, and lightly slick/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent coffee stout. All around great balance, robustness, and complexity of dark/roasted malt and coffee flavors; and very smooth to sip on. A very enjoyable offering.
Dark opaque with heavy coffee smell and taste. Enjoyable but a slight gap in taste between the coffee and beer flavours. Bottle slightly over date.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein fast schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch wunderbar röstmalzig, Vanille, Kaffee, dunkle Früchte. Geschmack röstmalzig, Espresso, Vanille, leicht herb.
At BBF. Black colour with beige head. Green coffee aroma, slightly roasted. Green coffe taste, slightly roasted, with some chocolate. Medium body.

From tap @ BBF 2014. Pours pitch black with a moderate brown head. Heavy espresso aroma, also coffee grounds. roasted malt. Flavor is light to moderate bitter, coffee grounds, intense coffee. Interesting but quite strong coffee notes for me.
On tap at Barcelona Beer Festival 2014. Dark color. Smooth body. Nice coffee aroma.

Bottle offered @ home, picked up @ Argonaut Denver a week or two back. Pours a deep brown appearance with a lasting, creamy, dark brown head. The coffee in the nose is phenomenal. Roasted but not overly bitter or acidic. A touch of smoke. Chocolate and vanilla. Fairly soft mouth feel. Medium bodied. Flavor really has a bit roasted coffee flavor without being stupidly overdone like many other coffee stouts. Maybe a touch of fruit, especially near the finish. A slight hint of anise and a little milky. This bad boy fucken kicks some serious ass.

On tap at BtlRev (Raleigh). 

Dark brown with tan head. Aroma powerful with coffee. First taste felt like coffee grounds. Espresso DOMINATES flavor, and aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - BCA - Opaque Black in colour. Very Malty; lots of espresso coffee, roasty malts, chocolate, caramel, some vanilla. Fruity; blackcurrants and dark fruits. Really intense coffee smell and taste; but not extreme. Nicely balanced. Very smooth. Sweet coffee chocolate malty and fruity throughout leading to some coffee bitterness in the finish. Super Coffee Stout!

330ml bottle at home. Black color with lasting beige head. Aroma is full of coffee. There is also some cocoa and vanilla and some notes of alcohol. Alcohol is 7% abv according to the bottles label and not 7.5%. Taste starts sweet, roasted malty with chocolate and it ends with bitter coffee. Medium body, sticky with average carbonation.

Tap. Pours opaque black, large brown head, nice lacing. Aroma is strong espresso, roasty, little else. Flavor is strong coffee, bit of ashtray, light sweet, medium bitter, light acidic. Wow, you need to love coffee to appreciate this one. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, lingering bitter finish.

330ml bottle from Carpenters, Carlow. Pours deep dark with 3 fingers frothy head which laces the glass. Fabulous smooth rich coffee aroma with toasted malt. Luxurious coffee taste with smooth chocolate which laces the tongue to give a full mouth feel. Low carbonisation and a balanced hoppiness which hardly peeps through. There is a lasting chocolate taste in the mouth. Very impressed with this one.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Pours opaque black with a large dark head. Expected aroma of coffee and biscuit. Flavours of malt, caramel, coffee. Just enough bitterness to offset the sweet caramel flavours without being overpowering. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Pretty impressed with this one.
Bottle at globe, hong kong. Black color, fabulous brown head. Aroma is cold coffee and chocolate, roasted malts also. Medium body, no co2. Interesting, like cold coffee with chocolate.
coffee, roasty, alcohol, soy sauce, black, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,
Bottle at Brewski. Super strong chocolate and roast coffee aromas, thick and creamy with a deep full bodied array of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate flavours. Love it.

Nose is vanilla, dark fruit and very, very strong coffee bean which dominates. Taste leads with vanilla which is quickly swamped with espresso, then dark chocolate before dark fruits peak through. Mouthfeel is silky.

Its a really nice beer, often when using espresso in the boil brewers have a bland base and there is no depth, this is different and is very good indeed.

Pours a deep brown with a brown head and lacing. It has an aroma of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malt. The flavor is coffee and chocolate up front with a sweet, malty finish over a medium-heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich brown pour. Smells like bakers chocolate. Dense, tan head. Tastes like good chocolate with a bite. Smooth and good. Finally, Im impressed with an Japanese beer.

7% bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is an inky black beer with ruby red highlights and a thin brigh brown head. It has very rich milk chocolate and liquorice flavours, red fruity notes and a roasted coffee finish. Superb!

Bottle.Lovely welcoming black appearance. Coffee flavour dominates.Medium body and creamy taste. Lives up to its appearance.
Highly recommended.

330 ml bottle poured into shaker. Deep cola color with a thin finger of reddish-tan head that disappears without a trace after a few minutes. Aroma is strong roasted coffee and sweet maltiness. Flavor follows suit, with a big roasted coffee profile with some sweetness in the middle and a bitter chocolate finish. Its a little on the thin side for a stout, but that contributes to its drinkability. Very impressive overall.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on a cold February night, after a hard day at work. Needed a treat...and this is it. Appearance is a murky thick black with a moderate tan head that nicely dissipates. Aroma is very rich in dark chocolate and espresso coffee, with notes of licorice, faint plum. Taste is rich and decadent, thick chocolate and bitter coffee. I would say the licorice comes out more in the flavor. Very good stuff, not sure if Ill have it again due to the price, but Im still happy that I was able to try this.
Good, standard espresso stout. Dark and rich flavors, but a bit on the lighter bodied side compared to some stouts. Dark chocolate and coffee notes. Solid stout.

Pours pitch black with a large tan head. Smells strongly of coffee with hints of chocolate. Taste is strong espresso with a subtle chocolate sweetness. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout finishes with a smooth coffee bitterness.

Bottle > Chino. Very good and lots of flavor and a perfect ABV at 7% to have out and about instead of the big bastards that I only drink at home. Not heavy heavy expresso flavor but plenty to justify the name and style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - malts are chocolate, coffee, roasty, alcohol, tobacco, and dark fruits (pruins). There is an oily note about the hops that are present.
Appearance - the color is black, the liquid opaque, the head a very small white head that quickly settles to a halo
Taste - the beer has sweetness, but is further on the roasted bitterness. The overwhelming property is bitter coffee, notably (espresso). Deep seated below the roast is some dark chocolate. 
Palate - the body is full, the textue slick and thick, the carbonation is stout appropriate; the finish bitter on the sides of the tongue and roast on the tops of the tongue.

Very complex brew in the best way - further emphasizes the joy of Hitachino Nests brews. Really nice stout, definitely on the roast bitter end of stout.

Aroma of bread, coffee, toast, fruity dark chocolate. Black with brown highlights, mocha coloured foam. Taste is much like aroma with diminished breadiness, with a pleasant chocolatey bitter finish, moving to a more lasting espresso like bitterness. Well balanced and not very sweet.
Dark brown color with a small off-white head. Has a chocolate and coffee aroma and flavor. Flavor is rich, and the beer is smooth. Excellent.

11.2oz bottle from Crossroads Spirits. Pours a deep dark brown/almost black color with a small foamy mocha head. Aroma of dark chocolate, sweet caramel, and roasted coffee. Taste of dark chocolate, char, rich espresso grounds, and toffee. Taste on this is killer!

Appearance: Dark brown/black with finger thick tan head.
Aroma: Coffee, toast, hint of liquorice. The coffee is very overpowering. 
Taste: Medium bitter and sourness, low/medium sweetness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, light/medium body, average carbonation, astringent bitter/sour coffee finish.
Comments: Lovely and glass lace. Rating is for 7% ABV bottled version.
Poured from bottle at fountainhead. Black with sticky brown head. Crazy choclate espresso and slight nutty taste. And aroma. Very enjoyable
Black, thin tan head. Nose is faint espresso, roasted malts, light chocolate. Taste is the same, some bitterness to the finish. Light smooth mouthfeel.

12-oz. bottle. Spicy, earthy coffee dominates the nose, with a heavy vegetal tone and a touch of roasted malt. Not surprisingly, it is the color of dark coffee, but with a almost pinkish-tan thin head. Balanced espresso and chocolate taste, with a little molasses and a roasty bitterness on the back end. Medium body with a slightly chalky finish. Just OK.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a dark brown/black colour. Medium to heavy slightly creamy body. Aroma of sweet malt, chocolate and espresso beans. Flavor of roasted sweet malt, coffee, rich chocolate, and some caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

O café se destaca nessa stout. Escura, boa formação de creme. Também nota-se chocolate no aroma e no sabor. Bela surpresa do Japão.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 This is the second bottle of this I have had and I have to say that this is one of my favourite stouts by far! It pours a thick oily like black with a big tan brown head. The smell is strong coffee mingled with dark chocolate, sweet malt (reminds me of the soft drink Supermalt) and traces of tiramisu desert along with some roasted bitterness and dark fruits like blackcurrant. The taste is very much black espresso coffee and dark chocolate mainly with slight vanilla notes which are nicely balanced with a roasted malt bitterness and its not quite as sweet as you are expecting from the smell. Wonderful! It feels oily and cloying in the mouth with very minimal carbonation. The finish is dry and leaves a lovely lingering bitterness still with the above mentioned flavours. Absolutely wonderful!

The aroma blends chocolate malts, caramel malts, coffee, and vanilla, and the appearance combines an opaque black color with a small light tan head. The taste is mildly bitter, mildly umami, and slightly sweet, and the palate combines an oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation, and a medium-length malty and coffee-esque finish.
Wowsers. Oil slick on top. Real thick. Chocolate at first, but rounds out to espresso. Amazing body. Very well done.

Ótima imperial Stout japonesa. Cor escura, com creme bege de media formação e aroma lembrando chocolate amargo, intenso. Na boca, bom corpo, com notas do malte torrado se sobressaindo, com amargor bem equilibrado. Final longo e aquecido. Ótima breja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is a sweet roasted malt and coffee. Strangely the sweetness isnt in the taste. Instead you get a dark roasty malt with a big coffee flavor. Long finish with a little chocolate. Very easy drinking. This is a great beer.

average frothy light brown head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick black body. aroma: light malty, milk chocolate, mild coffee, wood, alcohol. if: light sweet moderate bitter. ff: light sweet heavy bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation, metallic finish. Forte amargor de café, realmente lembrando expresso, toques lupulados também, dulçor maltado, leves notas chocolate amargo no background, bebida no mês do vencimento. Deixei de 10 a 15 min fora mas mesmo assim apresentou presença metálica no paladar.
Nota: 80 s

Bottle @SBWF 2013
Opaque black color, good beige-brown head. Aroma of coffee beans. Medium-bodied. Coffee, coffee beans, some dark-chocolate. A bit light palate for this ABV and this kind of beer. Ok coffee bean beer.

Dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, chocolate, & espresso beans; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, coffee, rich chocolate, and some caramel; Nicely balanced: Overall, this was really good.

Una delle migliori coffee stout che abbia mai bevuto. Sembra di bere un espresso, con un corpo denso e un complesso di note caramellate e tostate, legate anche da un appena percettibile aroma di cioccolato. Ogni italiano dovrebbe assaggiarla!! Il Giappone ha qualcosa da insegnare in fatto di birre.

330ml bottle, pitch black color, with a frothy pillowy tan head, nice espresso coffee, mocha, nutty, faint tiramisu cake, chocolate chip cookie dough nose, with some mild roasted coffee bean, burnt bran muffin, grainy roasted, pale, toasted, black, chocolate, caramel malt, café laté accents, and with a burnt brown chocolate, faint burnt toast note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good burnt bran muffin, mild grainy roasted, chocolate, black, toasted, caramel malty, black coffee, light dark bitter chocolate, burnt toast character, with some ground coffee bean, mocha, faint burnt nuts, burnt crumb flavours, leading towards a yeasty, grainy roasted, black, chocolate, toasted, caramel maltines, dark bitter chocolate, black coffee, burnt toast, burnt bran muffin, mocha, roasted coffee bean bitterness finish.
Very good. Nice smooth tatse with cocoa, coffee, and vanilla notes. Love the cocoa and cofffee finish.
Smells strongly of esptesso and pours dark almost non transparent brown/black with medium cream head. Tastes bitter from the espresso with a faint sweet cream. Ends quite bitter.

The beer is near black with a small beige head. The aroma brings some coffee presence, though not nearly as much as expected. Additional scents include roast, chocolate. Pretty standard. Decent flavor with coffee character leading the charge. A little bit acrid in the finish. Chocolate notes with a touch of bitterness. Pretty drinkable, but this is not near the top of its class.
2/6/2010. from bottle. Poured black with a tan head. Roasted malt aromas with coffee, chocolate and dark fruit. Smooth and balanced with a bitter finish. Awesome.
330ml bottle. pours a very dark brown. syrupy with tanned head. aroma is extremely strong of coffee. some molasses and toffee. rich taste of coffee. so much more coffee than any other beer ive had.
Botella. Buena presencia negra opaca con gran corona beige persistente. Aroma café y más café. En boca café y más café. Como su nombre indica una buena stout con café
Superb - strong Choc/coffee - coffee liqueur aftertaste - super smooth on the tongue - addictive stuff.

Fascinating to see the Japanese spin on this style. Great mouthfeel given the low ABV. Somewhat roasty stout base with a strongly discernible sweetness presumably from the dark fruits. Finishes, inexplicably, quite dry. The coffee notes dance in and out from view; I wouldn't mind seeing them more pronounced. But this is good. B+

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle->snifter. Black with thich tan head. A: coffee, licorice, toffee malt. T: same, with bittersweet aftertaste. Good.

12oz my place with Caesar. Aroma is big green bell pepper, coffee, nice roasted malt, big toasty, some dark raspberry chocolate. Taste is spicy green bell pepper, coffee, creamy milk chocolate, chalky cocoa nibs, burnt marshmallow malt.

Black pour with head only surviving around the edges. Aroma of coffee beans, vanilla and cherry. Smooth palate with flavours of espresso bitterness, prunes, roasted malt and milk chocolate. Great beer.

Cor preta com espuma caramelo de boa formação e persistência. Aroma de chocolate amargo e café expresso. Sabor que acompanha o aroma com chocolate amargo e café expresso, maltes torrados, muito bem equilibrada, sem amargor excessivo. Excelente!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I went back and forth with this bew. Do I like it or do I absolutely hate it! Thats what a good brew can do. It is caramel brown, not completely the stout I assumed. It has a billowy head. Coffee bean, cafe con leche taste. A simple stout. Semi-smooth wash down. I wish it wash a bit more bitter, like Lagunitas Cappacino Stout. But it is good! This is meant for a cool fall night.
Bottle 0.33l at home (via alesbymail). Besf before end: 03/14. Colour is deep black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malts.
Pours near black with a solid tan head. Big coffee aroma with licorice and chocolate. Taste is chocolate milk with a shot or two of espresso and some figs and dates blended in.
Pours a lovely black with a tanned head. Strong coffee smell. Lovely texture in the mouth with a coffee taste.

330 ml bottle bought at Craftissimo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Looks: Clear, deep cola blackish brown colour; Razor thin head and soapy beige foam which fades in 20 seconds; Very small sticky lacing and slight carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant roasted malt, with nice dark coffee, double cream, sugar, light chocolate, burnt toffee and moderate grass. Coffee nose get stronger and nicer with further sips.

Taste: Medium savory sweet dark roast malt, with a strong and very nice aftertaste of ice mocca. Wow! In between are strong espresso, burnt toffee, milk chocolate, liquorices, smoke, cream, dry biscuits, lime and pretty strong grassy hops. 

Body: Mid to light, with slick and very creamy palate.

Mouth Feel:Creamy and multi-layered, with very good roasty malt followed by good dose of café style espresso - bitter but nice - then a mix of smoke, chocolate and toffee, and rounded up with a fat slap of cool ice mocca. Excellent!

Hoppiness: good grass nose, strong lime nice grass hop taste, and just-right bitterness and memorable astringency for lasting finish.

After Taste: Quite dry; quite easy and creamy to mouth.


Comments: This one excels in many ways - consistent espresso aroma and taste, creamy mouth feel, smoky and malty to name but a few - most important for me, however, is that incredible refreshing ice mocca after taste which make me feel something really special. This one is right up there. A Classic!

From 9/29 notes. Shared with John for Breaking Bad finale tasting, beer #4. 12oz bottle pours black with very small head into tulip. Nose is coffee, licorice, chocolate syrup. Mouthfeel is smooth, airy, fairly light, low carbonation. Taste is milky, dark roasty coffee, light, milk chocolate. Finish is a pleasant creamy bitter coffee, lingers. Very good.

Bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Forms a beautifully creamy, tan head not dissimilar in texture to foamed milk (appropriate for an espresso stout!). Body the darkest of browns. Aroma is, unsurprisingly, dominated by strong coffee, paired with some cocoa-like notes. Taste follows. Mouthfeel is that Im drinking a large iced espresso - medium bodied but a shade oily. The head though is a creamy delight. Lovely beer, I shall be tracking down more from Kiuchi.

330ml bottle. Darkest brown colour with average to huge, firm, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Dark malty aroma with notes of mocha, chocolate, nougat. Taste is dry, roasty dark malty, espresso notes, subtle sweetness in between, a touch of black currant; lasting finish with still intense coffee notes. Superb.

Funny thing; my rating consisted of 3 cartoons: 1. a teddybear crying, pleading for the raw hard roasty malts, tearing it apart, to stop. 2. a cute kitten, in tears as well, being real upset with the horrible wooden pencil-sharpener- notes and 3. a crazy monkey just not liking it. This is a bit to thin and sharp stout.

Bottled. Pours dark brown in color with a tan head. Aroma has some raw coffee, feels sligthly green as well. Cold coffee, some green hoppyness and even some light bitterness appears towards the end. But on the whole this just feels too green for me and doesnt reach a great level.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer&Whisky Festival 2013. Black beer with a nice beige head. Coffee aroma, roasted, licorice, dried fruits, caramel, cocoa powder, malty, biscuits, some figs and raisins. Roasted chocolate aroma, caramel, leather, cocoa, coffee, licorice, some biscuits. Roasted coffee finish with dark chocolate, raisins, figs, some licorice. Great beer!
Dark brown with dark foamy head. Enticing aroma of café con leche. The body is smooth, sweet, coffee and cacao nib with a very gentle roasty finish.
Roasted coffee beans nose. Rich malt flavor, lovely coffee, touch of caramel, nuts, bitter finish. Nice and deep stout, perfect to end a large diner.

(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a dark brown head; aromas of roast, coffee, smoked fruit, bitter chocolate; creamy palate; rich strong balanced flavour with long moderately bitter finish; very good
Pours thick black with low head. Aroma is roast and rich coffee, taste is similar with a very smooth and rich finish
Slightly smoky/roasty coffee and syrup aroma. Very dark brown with a medium thick tan head. Medium bodied dry roast coffee and malt. Some effervescence on the tongue.

Aroma has mainly notes of dark chocolate, cacao powder and roasted cacao beans. Deep black color, brownish head. Flavor has intensive notes of coffee and cacao beans, sweet espresso,dark fruits, dark chocolate, cacao powder. Very roasty finish with a roast bitter end. World class!

From a 33cl bottle, pours a deep black with a thick beige head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Flavors of dark chocolates, coffee, malts, grass, hops, and sugar. Creamy in mouth, light carbonation, light bitterness and light sweetness, strong coffee and chocolate flavors, well balance, quite rich taste, very enjoyable.

Bottle. Black beer with a strong light brown head. The aroma is lightly roasted with a hint of malt, and the flavour is gently bitter with quite a high degree of roasted and burnt ness. Overall a nice stout but not strong enough for espresso.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Svart farge med beige skum. Lukt av kaffe, sjokolade og godt røstet malt. Smak av røstet malt, kaffe, sjokolade og frukt. Patriks.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2013 bottled I like coffee , I like beer more- if you unite  the two drinks  together -like with chocolate beers , I prefer this  aspect to not have domination over the whole damn   beer !!!.  Drink a Youngs Chocolate and tell me you get much texture other than generic chocolate , I dont think so personally .   This Espresso beer is really bitter and tastes of nothing much other than coffee...faint stout vibes of roast malt and caramel are there  ...An ok gimick ,but not my thing.

Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout has a thick, creamy, beige head, a very dark brown appearance, and pretty good lacing left behind. The aroma is of heavily roasted barley malt, dark coffee, faint chocolate, and black cherries. Taste is of acidic, sour, dark-roasted malt, black coffee, cherries, and some chocolate. Mouthfeel is mostly heavy and syrupy, and Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout finishes rich, sweet, charred, and dry. Overall, this is an interesting and well-made flavored beer. I score it most excellent. RJT
Poured a murky deep brown with a foamy beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate and roast malt. Medium body, flavour of bitter dark chocolate, toasted malt and a bitter sweet finish.

Bottle poured into snifter. Color is black with a thin, foam khaki ring, no head, and sticky web lacing scattered on the glass. Aroma is large roast, coffee, malt. Flavor follows nose with big roast, malt, cocoa, coffee, and a loooong satisfying char finish layered with chocolate. This is a great stout - surprisingly so. Must buy more of these.
dark brown, medium brown head with long retention. tons of coffee, chocolate, roast, slight smoke, earth. medium-heavy bitter, light sweet. full body, creamy feel, soft carb, slight warmth

Light aromas of chocolate and malt. 
Taste of caramel chocolate and coffee. Great mouthful with a long after taste the sits on the side of your tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Aroma has mainly notes of dark chocolate, cacao powder and roasted cacao beans. Deep black color, brownish head. Flavor has intensive notes of coffee and cacao beans, sweet espresso,dark fruits, dark chocolate, cacao powder. Very roasty finish with a roast bitter end. World class!
Looks dark brown, smells like espresso and coffee beans, taste like coffee and with strong bitterness. Great beer and strong beer.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Perry Barr is not exactly Lake Geneva and this Stout is not is not the 4th best Stout in the World, but it is a lovely Stout - nice and sweet and flavoursome, et al. No steak for me tonight. Dont leave us Dom.

Bottle. Pours a dark, dark oily brown-black with a high, cinnamon fine-grained head. The head just sits there -- very solid appearance. Nose is dark chocolate and raisins -- imagine if Valrhona made Raisinets. Sweet on the front of the mouth, almost confectionary... then the coffee kicks in with a vengeance, a deep, smoky espresso tone that moves flawlessly into a deep chocolate finish. Perfect mouthfeel; I cant recall a beer this velvety. Amazing.

330ml bottle. Pours a deep inky black color with two fingers of thick, dense, tan head and light lacing. Aroma is rich espresso grounds on the with dark chocolate and hints of dark fruit. Taste is big roasted malt and dark coffee bitterness up front. Dark chocolate covered cherries through the middle. Chocolate sweetness peaks before more coffee bitterness closes out the finish. The body is thick and syrupy with some light carbonation and a nice lingering warmth that coats the palate.

Single bottle. Dark brown pour with a small khaki head. Strong coffee aroma with some fig and roasted malt in the background. More bitter chocolate in the flavor than in the aroma, but still mostly strong espresso. A little thin, but still has a creamy mouthfeel. Very good.
Svart öl med medelstort moccafärgat skum. Mörk choklad, lakrits och soja i aromen. Detsamma i smaken plus mjuk kaffe och vanilj. Kolsyrig munkänsla.

Cette bière est définitivement une belle trouvaille du côté de lOrient. Les Nippons ont su créer une bière forte, aux arômes teintés de chocolat, de vanille et de noisettes. Une bonne bière en fonction du rapport qualité/prix. À essayer absolument !

330ml bottle poured into snifter. Pours a nice deep and dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is intense espresso with some serious roast, as well as some vanilla and hints of dark chocolate. Taste is medium sweet, medium...roasted (I know, this isnt really a taste per but I just cant seem to describe it better than that). Palate is slick/creamy with lively carbonation. This is truely a gem of a stout. I wanted to taste it for a LONG while and I finally found some at Westmere beverage in Albany NY while en route to Philly. I would buy this as a regular if I could. But I live in Quebec, Canada and well...if youre from there you know our importation laws suck. Buy this brew. Now.

Bottle 330ml @ Bakgården Både &, Kristiansand
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, caramel and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with and long coffee and roasted finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

At Epic Beer Fest 2013. Black pour with a thin beige head. Aroma of toasty black malt and a little over-roasted espresso. Flavor is a little overly roasty with dark acrid flavors with a touch of espresso that doesnt really make it better.

Bottle thanks to Jmgreenuk. Pours almost black with a small beige head. Aroma is big espresso, roast, some dark chocolate and a little dark fruit. Flavour is light moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle from Appellation Wines. Appearance - opaque black with a generous creamy fawn head. Nose - roasted coffee beans with some creaminess. Taste - dark chocolate and coffee. Palate - medium to full bodied with a slightly overly rich finish. Overall - the problem with this style of beer is that the coffee dominates too much.

From bottle at 2013 Portland International Beerfest. Black with tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and strong coffee. Taste is quite prominently espresso with sweet dark malt notes, with almost an underlying chili presence.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with medium tan head, expresso coffee aroma, big coffee taste must have been involved after brew, some chocolate and smokiness , amazed this has a 99 its competent but not amazing.

0.33l bottle shared with Inbreak @ Øltorget. This is a deep dark brown one almost black in the glass and it has a heavy lacing dark grey-brown head. Lovely on the nose. Lots of yeah, espresso and vanilla. The coffee smells really fresh, cold and delicious. Not to pushy just delicate, strong and yummy. Lovely flavors also. Lacking a bit on the almost flat carbonation, and the mouthfeel is thin oily. Immediately i get a weird beef stock sensation, the espresso is really doing its thing in the mouth. Chocolate chips, something almost herbal, lots of roasted goodness before its leaving a strong Nesquick-like aftertaste in the mouth. A really tasty espresso stout. 24.05.2013
Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours black with a beige to brown head, aroma of coffee, roasted malt, flavor of coffee, malt, nice bitterness, medium bodied

Appearance: Very dark brown, basically black. Nice tan head.
Aroma: Coffee, then some dark malt.
Taste: Lots of coffee, some dark malt. Bitterness.
Info: 330ml bottle, 13/6-2013

Aroma of chocolate, fruit, and roasted malts. Pours a solid black with a robust, mostly lasting, khaki head and moderate lacing. The taste is medium bitter. Chocolate and dark roasted coffee bitterness with notes of dark fruit and some biscuitiness on the finish. There is a lingering nice bitter coffee aftertaste. Full body and moderate carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Overall, a smooth, mildly bitter stout. Very enjoyable.
Smell of red wine, raisins, licorice. Black colour, dark brown head. Aroma of coffee, raisins, cocoa, tar. Bitter and sweet. Surprisingly not oily. Very heavy, long finish.

Bottle from Appellation Wines - Cheers Ash! Pours a good black, but the head doesnt hang around. Aromas are coffee, chocolate, as expected. Taste has something metallic Im not liking. Overall - not a bad beer, but the worst this brewery has to offer.

Bottle. Looks lovely - black with a crazy, bubbly, tan coloured head. Creamy coffee up your nose. Coffee, lightly roasted malts, hoppy bitterness, some sourness from a fruit and the taste of a lone pine on a rock. A bit lighter feel than other coffee stouts and a bit of a fizz.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with medium creamy tan head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is coffee bean and roasted chocolate. Thin mouthfeel with light roast, chocolate, and light dry finish. Very impressive stout.

Bottle at The Flying Elk.

Black with a creamy tan head. Aroma and taste of espresso, roasted malt, some chocolate, some dark fruit and licorice. Medium body and carbonation. Descent.
Bottle. Dark and strong bodied beer. Strong flavor of coffee and mild aftertaste
